title: Highly frustrating!
text:
I had waited months for the release of the botvac D7 connected. It finally was released and I ordered one right away. I have had nothing but problems since I got it! The vac won’t stay connected to the app. I have gone through all the steps. Restarted, reconnected over and over again. It won’t stay connected to the app for more than several seconds before it goes off line. I have contacted customer support and after several days they finally wrote and told me to do what I have already tried several times myself (and I explained that when I initially wrote). Yes I have strong WiFi signal and the base is right near the router. 
Now I am waiting to hear back from them again. The vac seems to work OK off line. However, the whole reason I wanted this model was so that I could set up my no go lines. Which you can’t do if it won’t connect to the app. So.... every time I start the vac it makes a bee line for my couch and wedges itself underneath and I have to retrieve it only for it to immediately go back and do the same thing. They don’t send enough magnetic strip to outline the whole couch so I can’t keep it away! It’s obsessed with trying to get under my couch. I have a huge house, over 2500 square feet on the bottom floor and it won’t leave this one spot alone. What gives? 
I’m ready to throw this very expensive thing out the window!

title: Needs notice when APP is down.
text:
The IOS application was down due to technical difficulties and the only way I could find out was calling your customer service line and waiting to get a hold of a live person. There wasn’t even a prerecorded message when I called their customer service. 

When the application was logged in already when I first opened it, the app couldn’t find my neato vacuum. I kept getting errors like “something went wrong”. I then started to troubleshoot my vacuum. I thought maybe there was something wrong with the vacuum and I reset it. That didn’t fix it. This is a brand-new vacuum I thought, not even two days old there shouldn’t be anything wrong with it. I’m starting to get ideas like did I get a lemon and I need to swap it out? Maybe it’s the app on my phone since this is my second neato and I did not uninstall the app when I added this new Neato D7. So I uninstalled and reinstalled the app. Making several unsuccessful attempts to login i thought maybe I forgot my password and tried to reset it and had problems with that too. So I called customer service to find their app is down. 

A lot of effort for a customer when you could of just had a notice that your servers are under maintenance when I first opened the app. I’m sure I’m not the only one who’s troubleshooted their vacuum like this when they’re having issues starting their vacuum because your servers are down.

title: No longer connects to Wi-Fi
text: Okay first and foremost it must be Neato software not my router configuration so I don’t wish to contact your customer service. That is if you even reply to my review since it looks like you pick and choose which ones receive a reply. My D5 vac has worked perfectly up until recent months and then it just stopped working since it can no longer connect fully to my Wi-Fi. I’ve read many reviews on the App Store and elsewhere and it seems I fall into a similar group having the similar issues. It all started months ago when you activate the vacuum and it says your map/vacuum position is invalid. Why? Nothing has changed literally nothing. Second and now most problematic is the fact I cannot simply reconnect it to my Wi-Fi. I never disconnected in the first place and if I did I know how to connect to it properly since I’ve done it many times in the past from moving and or changing internet providers. Never had any issues then either. Not a one until now. I once read in an online review that Neato was the Apple of home vacuums.  Probably a quote from the author. You might make a fine vacuum that might cut it but the app or software is definitely not on par with Mac OS or iOS or even your rivals. Please update soon or I will have to take my money else where for a product that is more dependable. For Pete’s sake the dust bunnies are no longer scared and actually collecting around my floor paperweight of a vacuum. If I could post a pic I would.

title: Pretty good
text: I love my robot!! It's so much easier now that it cleans for me. It cleans very well, although it does get stuck on my frilly carpet once in a while. It would be nice if the filter can open so I can clean it, but since it doesn't I put a tissue over it so the filter doesn't get super dusty. Also, the wheels of the robot aren't large enough to roll into one of the bathrooms I have that's about 2-3 cm talkers than the regular floor. So it constantly gets stuck and tries to go into the bathroom. Maybe they should upgrade the size ? Oh! And I noticed that when the wheels get stuck, the plastic things on the wheel falls off and leaves some remains on the floor, maybe if the material of the wheels were different it would be better as well. I believe that the app should have a function where I can click return to the base. Sometimes the robots done cleaning but it doesn't go back home, so it's quite annoying when I have to walk to the robot and drag it back to the base. It would be nice if the app had an upgrade where you can control where your robot is like a remote, although I don't think that'll be happening anytime soon. Overall, my robots been really helpful with cleaning, but there are things that should be fixed by the creators of the app and robot.

title: Still not what it could be
text:
*** Updated, based on developers comments, to 4 stars. However virtual borders should be a simple software implementation for BotVac Connected and newer vacuums. Again, not yet worth the upgrade due to no definitive must have upgrades in the latest BotVac vacuum. If you are new to the market, it is the best one out there for quality and money. 

2 stars - When we first purchased our Neato BotVac Connected, it was the latest one at the time, connected to your wifi, you could control it through the app, etc. There were two features in the app that were very helpful. The first was the ability to send the robot back to the base.  For some reason they removed it and have not brought that feature back. The other feature was the ability to control the robot with directional arrows. This was also removed without reason. The latest robot only brings virtual borders that you can put in the app. There is no reason this feature cant be implemented on current Wifi connected botvacs. I am not spending another $700 for a small feature after you have taken away others. If you are just buying into the market, maybe it is worth it, but if you are looking to upgrade, you have given us zero incentive.

title: Not great. Slow, unreliable and missing functionality.
text:
I’ve been using the Neato for some
Months now. I’m fairly disappointed with the app and robot. 

- the app is often slow to respond 
- error messages appear when adding zones to the cleaning map stating that is cannot be saved, although the newly added zones are saved. 
- often there are weird problems. For example: today it states it is “ready to clean”. But when starting it, it immediately switches back to “ready to clean”. Restarting the app is not helping. 
- I really miss an option to let it do multiple zones of my choice at once. (Or combining zones).
- zones can only have rectangular shapes. Combining multiple into one is not possible. 
- the  option to operate manually is really unworkable, apart from being a fun gimmick on your first day. It’s nerve wrecking slow. 
- robot seems to completely lose its orientation after being moved my less than cm 
- I miss an option to help the robot know it’s approximate location and orientation, after it got lost 
- the software does not learn how to navigate furniture legs it has trouble with. (One table and bar stool with shiny legs that seem to disorientate the navigation in such a way that it keeps hugging the legs.  Another set of chairs that have a thin metal pipe on the ground which keeps trying to cross but fails. )
- I miss the option to send feedback about type of furniture it has major trouble with so the developers can improve the software.

title: Simple but requires strong Wifi
text: This Neato apps is simple to setup and connect to your robot vacuum. But it needs a fairly strong Wifi connection, especially if you want to maintain progress reports & location updates. So if you have dead spots in your home's Wifi coverage and your Neato bot happens to be in it then you will lose connection. All you can do is wait for the bot to re-enter a strong Wifi area and you will be re-connected. You can employ a Wifi extender like I did, and have the bot stationed near the extender. Just don't make changes to its setting while the bot is working like changing its name, then you will have to reset the connection and start all over in setting up the bot's schedule. When it came to stopping the bot in its vacuum run the Dock button in the apps would not work for my D5 Neato after I remotely stopped it, and I had to physically shut off the bot and carry it back to the charging base. The mapping feature is accurate but as I mentioned it needs a strong Wifi connection to create a complete image. In future updates to this apps I would like to see a feature that allows the user to program the bot to vacuum selected areas of the floor layout, after the bot has completely mapped the home. Overall this apps great!

title: Great vacuum; incredibly frustrating app
text: The vacuum itself does a great job in terms of cleaning and navigation, but this app is absolutely awful. It constantly shows an “updating new map” notification whenever I want to start the vacuum, and stays on that screen for 15-20 minutes—sometimes longer. More times that not, I’ll also get an error notification without any explanation as to what might be the problem. On the days that I can get past those app issues and actually run the vacuum using the “invisible lines feature”, occasionally it’ll just drop the WiFi connection and stop vacuuming in the middle of a room. All of these things combined make this vacuum more of a hassle than manually vacuuming myself. It’s clear that the vacuum had a lot of potential, but after Neato was purchased by a larger company, it’s blatantly obvious that they have no intention of fixing the bugs on this app (considering they have recently responded to several reviews without addressing any of the problems many people have mentioned). They’ve also recently come out with a new line of robotic vacuums (under the same Neato name), and have a separate app solely for those new products. Absolutely 10/10 would NOT purchase a vacuum by Neato ever again, solely based on how poorly this app was developed and maintained.

title: Failing miserably
text:
Update: my review was first written two months ago. It took me about 3 weeks to get the app to work at that point after owning it for over a year with no problems. It then worked for about a month and has quit again. I am doing all the resets and checking my router, etc. It hasn’t worked with the app in 12 days now. After working seamlessly for more than a year and now constantly having problems for 2 months, this is frustrating. We actually changed internet providers in early November and have better service so I would expect less problems (though i never had any before). The app gets stuck on the “name your robot” screen and then won’t move on to the next screen. I have wasted HOURS trying to get the app to work.  

Original review: I have had this model for over a year and have loved the vacuum and the app. I had a previous Neato that didn’t have an app, and the addition of the app was amazing. When I updated the vacuum and app, as the app told me to do a couple of weeks ago, the app has quit working with my vacuum. I have literally spent over 2 hours trying to reprogram it this and last week week and it still won’t work. I’m frustrated that I paid more than other brands to get features that now won’t work.

title: Great Vac, Terrible App
text:
This review has nothing to do with the actual vacuum cleaner, which works really well. The problem is entirely with this app which continuously drops connection to the Internet requiring frequent re-boots. I’ve had the vacuum for over a year and probably have to reset it at least once a week. I have no problems with connection to the many other devices I have in my home. I have a very strong Wi-Fi connection. This app is definitely the issue. After the latest update, it dropped connection to my vacuum as usual. I have been unable to get connected again. As you go through the steps to establish connection, I was able to connect the vacuum after following the set-up instructions. The next step, the app does not even show my router or any other router. My phone, computer, TV and everything else has a connection. I manually typed it in and then it will show up. At this point, I think I’m home free but I cannot get past the part where I name the vacuum. I typed in the same name I’ve used in the past and it stalls. 

Don’t waste your money getting a Connected vac because you really get very little use out of that part of it anyway. Just buy the best vacuum and don’t worry about the Connected features. Until they over hall this app entirely it is not worth it’s time.

title: Almost there
text:
We got the ‘bot about a week ago and are over the moon with its success. It goes places the big vac cannot, and cleans better than the stick vac we normally use. The app makes it easy to schedule and humanizes the bot. We have a Pro6 mesh router, and there were no problems setting up and using the vac in the farthest corners of the house; it has never dropped from WiFi. 

There are a few drawbacks: the cleaning zones must be rectangular, which is inadequate for our ‘50’s style home. It wouldn’t be a problem if we could combine areas in software, or even queue a series (eg, “Hallway, mud room, breakfast area”), but that isn’t possible either. Since cleaning times can vary depending on barriers posed by toys and pets, the schedule has to be looser than it needs to be, meaning that time is wasted returning to base, or worse, skipping the area if the previous job runs long. It seems like this should be an easy fix. Otherwise, it is still way easier and better than hand vaccing. Love how clean the house is.

title: Botvac works well, app not so much
text:
I own 4 of these Botvacs due to having a multi-level house. I will say that my floors are cleaner than they’ve ever been. So, here come the “but”... the Botvacs lose wi-fi connection a lot for no reason, as I have excellent wi-fi coverage throughout the house. As far as the app goes ... Getting push notifications is mostly a miss. Getting maps of what was cleaned rarely works. In some cases the most current maps are over a month old. Reconnecting to wi-fi can be time-consuming.

EDIT: I was immediately contacted by Neato Support with “iTunes Connect - Low Review” in the subject line. After a week of back and forth emails, the end of the line was for me to go into my router and modem settings to change a bunch of settings, which they would only give me sketchy instructions, and they weren’t willing to go any further than that. I’m a techie kind of guy, but even the things that they wanted me to do would require professional help, and I can’t imagine the average person being able to do what they asked. In other words, they’re not sure what to do and they’re asking me to make some global changes to “see” if that will work. So, I’ve gotten nowhere and will limp along until they get it figured out. Apparently I’m not the only one with app issues. It’s a shame.

title: Wish for more functionality
text: I wish both the app and robot had more functionality.  For the app I wish i could: 1. better design zones with something more than rectangles. 2. have a mapping function that would skip the vacuuming so u could map without waiting for the battery to recharge to almost 90% before finishing. 3. wish i could define how much re-charge to do to finish an area so i didn't have to wait so long. 3. wish i could see current locations the robot is on demand (that way i could see if i want to allow finishing off a zone out just sending it home. 4. Wish the robot could re-find its location more easily by noting certain landmarks (on the map) so it could lidar and find its way. 4b. Wish i could help it finds it way through the app map by pressing on its relative location in the map (it thinks it's here but i let it know it's over there).. Happens with tables and chairs and kids. 5. Wish it could handle higher ply rugs. 6. Wish I didn't have to re-map a whole level b/c of small furniture change i could re-map the area.

title: The The robots seem ok, but the app and it’s ability to control them is terrible!
text: After the firmware and app upgrades in the first quarter of 2020, one of my two D7 robots would stopped responding to the app; it always showed up as off-line even though it was connected to Wi-Fi (I could tell by looking at my access points and the blue light on the robot). The Neato support team told me to delete the missing robot from the app and re-add it. I deleted it, and have been unable to re-add it ever since. I have spent hours on the phone with Neato tech-support, and they aren’t able to offer me any useful assistance. I received an email from Neato telling me they are sorry, they don’t know what the problem is, and that’s why I haven’t heard from them. So I have a vacuum for which I paid several hundred dollars sits useless because the app and/or firmware update have rendered them that way. I did manage to reconnect the vacuum to the Neato servers once (I could not control it with the app, but at least it was following its previous programming), but Neato insisted I needed to disconnect the robot and try again. I once again have an expensive robot vacuum that does nothing. It is, essentially, bricked!

title: Great Vac, Ok App
text:
The app lets you start cleanings, notifies you when the dust bin is full, if the robot has any troubles, and lets you setup a floor plan with no-go lines. For all that it does it’s job wonderfully well.

Gotta call Neato out though, the app can have much more expanded functionality. Since most parts between robots are the same and they run on essentially the same software you guys really should unlock features dedicated to higher end models to also be available to the lower end. I can’t imagine there’s any good reason to hide “clean a specific room” to just the D7, and I’d challenge anyone from the Neato team to tell me otherwise with a non-BS explanation. 

These robots are really exceptional at their job, and the app can be a tool to elevate that experience. Making “gentle navigation” not available for scheduled cleanings is also baffling. There’s just some very basic software functionality that isn’t being utilized when it could be. Would really love to rate this app higher but I’m sensing there is some pushback from those who are making the app to not allow all the functionality to be available to users.

title: NEATO Needs More Stars
text: I just got a D7 for Christmas and I am in love. The setup was extremely simple and the steps were easy to follow. Had it connected in no time. Once setup, I ran the special cleaning to setup my Floor plan— went off without a hitch! I then setup all my zones— very easy process & renaming for easy navigation is done in a snap. The vacuum is extremely powerful— the housekeeper came just last week, and the amount of debris Fran picked up on her first run was unbelievable. She leaves vacuum lines in my carpet— you can really tell that she’s done a great job cleaning. This first run, I had to empty the bin about 3 times for 1000sqft house. I was happy to empty, because I knew she was removing all of this dirt and dust from my home. I expect follow up cleanings to feature less emptying... I have set the schedule to have Fran clean twice per week, so it shouldn’t get too dirty between cleanings. Thank you so much for a wonderful & exciting adventure with my new D7, Fran!

title: Unreliable
text: When our Neato D4 actually connects to clean, it does a nice job — a fairly strong vacuum, thorough, gets in tight spaces. However, it’s highly unreliable. It loses the Wi-Fi connection often, an issue that’s nonexistent with the many other Wi-Fi connected devices in our home. It forgets the floor plan we created, so I have to be home to run a new plan & keep the vac from getting stuck in places where I had “no go” lines drawn for previous floor plans it forgot. This issue and the Wi-Fi issues mean I often cannot run it when away from home and come home to clean floors, the whole point of a connected robot vac. It tells me the app requires an update, despite having the latest version available in the app store…requiring deleting the app, reinstalling, and starting over. This lack of reliability renders the device nearly useless. And it’s not just an issue with this particular device; we’ve had two previous D4s replaced under warranty (one a battery defect, one these same issues), so the lack of quality seems endemic to Neato. Great idea, poor execution. We’ll surely get another robot vac, but from a Neato competitor with a better track record.

title: Could be a lot better
text:
I’ve had the D7 for about a year.  While it occasionally gets stuck under furniture or in the middle of our closet (that it found the way into) that is probably more the robot’s issue not the app.  

However there are a number of issues with the app that I have run into:
1. It will warn you that the dust bin needs to be emptied, which is great. But it does this before a cleaning cycle instead of after one.  That means when you leave for work and it’s full, the cycle triggers while you are away and then gets stopped because it’s full so it doesn’t run.  Would be much better to prompt for service AFTER a cycle.
2. There is no option to pause operation, pause the schedule, or return to base based on your location.  It would be great if I came home during a cycle if it would either ask me what to do or automatically return to base.
3. You can’t schedule or manually start multiple zones at once.  You can have overlapping zones which partially solves this issue, but you can’t just say clean the kitchen, bedroom, and front hall in that order.  Nor can you delay a cleaning, IE: Clean the kitchen starting in 30min.  So if you are trying to clean say 3 zones overnight, you have to schedule them so that the robot returns to base in between and the times do not overlap.
4. This app hasn’t been updated in a year.  Apparently they just abandoned all the previous generation vaccum owners.  Not great.  I would have expected at least a few more years of improvements.

title: Refuses to connect
text: I bought my D3 connected roughly a year ago if not less, I was so thrilled at how it worked and the detailed map of where my bot cleaned while I was sleeping, about 5 months into owning it however the app just quit working and I tried several times to reboot, the bot still worked but wouldn’t connect to the app. I have called customer service several times and wasted hours on the phone to no avail. I have several wifi enabled products in my home and none have ever lost connection outside of obvious circumstances. My Neato is set up right next to my wireless router but cannot find it, meanwhile somehow  it finds my neighbors router. I’ve gone and typed in the router name and though ok I’ve got it but no it won’t let me get past naming the bot now... while the vacuum still works quite well the inability to use the app or run it on a schedule is super frustrating. I spent a lot of time looking for the vacuum that was right for me with 4 young kids and a golden retriever and was so sure I’d made the right choice both financially and from a performance standpoint but sadly I’m regretting what feels like money and time wasted.

title: Works Spottily, Confusing Sometimes
text: Updated, since my robot wasn’t connecting but it is connected now: Here and there I have trouble with the app. It has great features — they added no-go lines for the Connected D5 in the last year so I get to make use of that. When the app works, it’s great! It lets me know when the robot gets stuck, where it is, and the scheduled cleaning days make keeping the floors clean easy. If I had any requests, it would be perhaps to make an “every two days” schedule, as right now I have it set to Mon-Wed-Fri-Sun, which means it runs two days in a row out of the week. The interface isn’t perfect but it’s easy enough to understand, and whenever I’ve had an issue the response is always quick. I just wish solving connectivity issues was easier, but that may be my home internet. Otherwise it’s great to leave vacuuming to this! I have two dogs and two birds and there’s always plenty to clean up after.

title: Need older version of App
text:
Just purchased Neato D5 connected and have been unable to pair with my iPhone. After lengthy discussions with Neato support that unit was returned and a new unit tried....again unable to pair.  Modem, router all meet specs, the only criteria not met is that the App requires the vacuum to be 4.0 version.  After speaking with support that version has only been available a couple of weeks and without the App there is no other means available to upgrade the software on the D5. What an oversight on Neato’s behalf.   I am still reeling that such a sophisticated vacuum can have such a limited App and a single method for upgrades in this day of amazing technology.  There should be an older version of the App available to at least get it to pair with phone and then have the capability to download the update  for the vacuum and then move on to the newer version of App.  Has no one else experienced this?   I am so impressed with this vacuum, it’s smart and does an impressive job cleaning.  I just need it paired.  Any suggestions would be so appreciated.  

Sent from my iPhone

title: Overall I think Neato products are the best
text:
I like Neato vacuums far better than my previous iRobot ones. Unfortunately I’ve found they only last about 2 years before either the lidar stops spinning, or the wheels just stop moving. $600 for 2 years is a little under a dollar a day. I’m sure there are better value’s out there, but overall I really do like the Neato system.
Just a few issues other than the longevity of the hardware….
1. The initial setup is brutal. I had to keep restarting my new Neato vac 4 or 5 times in order for the setup process to complete. I didn’t do anything different, just kept on trying.
2. When doing the initial floor map… just make it so the vacuum goes around and focus on just making the floor map. My first floor has a higher square footage (and I have a Labrador that sheds everywhere), so in just trying to map this floor, I’ve ran out of batteries, and another time I’ve run out of dust bin space. Just have the thing drive around and map.

title: Manual Mode Inop in Latest Update
text: I didn’t have any problems until the recent update. Now, on my iPad 9.7 (iOS 13.4.1) the Manual mode doesn’t work; my Botvac Connected operates perfectly in Manual mode with my iPad Air (iOS 12.4.6) BECAUSE IT DOESN’T HAVE NEATO LOCATION SERVICES. The app keeps disconnecting/reconnecting and gives a false “ Please clean my brush” error when initiating movement of the Botvac only while in Manual mode; if no movement is initiated, Manual mode just stops and the app returns to the status screen that shows “Ready to Clean.”  Also, Location Services must be set to “While Using...” or “Always” for Manual mode to even start. Otherwise, the error “Manual Clean Not Available: Connect your robot and iPhone to the same Wi-Fi network“ will be displayed. And, according to the website’s FAQ’s, “you can pair your robot with up to 10 different Wi-Fi networks from the same Neato app.” However, the app doesn’t have the Wi-Fi option under Robot Settings as described and shown in the screenshots.

title: Horrible App and Support
text:
The Botvac itself is great but it constantly loses connection with the app and you need to go through the process of uninstalling the app, resetting the vacuum, reconnecting it over and over again until it decides to work. We’ve had this vacuum for about 2 years and I’m about to just toss it and buy something else, which is a shame because the device itself works well. 

But why not reach out to support? Well, they’re just about useless. They’ll talk about your router’s DNS being wrong, they’ll blame your SSID (yeah, apparently my SSID is “wrong”), they’ll claim your WiFi channels are all wrong, they’ll insist your network is at fault all the time. It doesn’t matter that you have a house full of devices that work flawlessly, it doesn’t matter that you do network stuff professionally, they’ll insist your network is at fault. It’s like they just spin a wheel of networking terms and whatever it lands on is what they blame. They should be embarrassed about the quality of support they provide for people who spend hundreds of dollars on these devices.

title: Botvac disconnects all the time. The app is junk
text: The robot is connected to the internet per my router, but for whatever reason it disconnects at least once a month on average( but often multiple times a month, then will be fine for a few months), some times it will magically reconnect after a few days, others it just doesn’t and requires that I uninstall the app, reinstall, then set up the vacuum as a new device. It’s absurd. Every time I’ve put in a help ticket (it took me a while to figure out exactly what works to fix it) Neato has blamed the issue on my router, despite roughly a dozen other smart devices having no issues with connection at all. I feel confident the issue is related either to their app or their server. I wish there was a way to just have it run via wifi regardless of needing an outside internet connection so it doesn’t require the Neato server to be working properly. It’s so frustrating. I love the device but hate the app/service.

title: Useless
text: This app is useless. As others have said when you pair a D7 to the app it always goes offline. The schedule to clean certain rooms works half the time.  Mine gets lost every time going to the kitchen trying to crawl into the fire place or getting stuck under a side table.  You move it back to the base and do it again and it does the same thing but if you do a whole house clean it has zero issues. What gives neato?  Your customer service is a joke, you parrot a script and don’t know anything about your own product. Your software updates fried my d3’s motherboard and you wouldn’t repair it so I got this one.  The product itself is decent and cleans well but your software developers have no idea what they are doing and you don’t support your product if you cause a issue that causes expensive damage to the hardware. You really need to re-evaluate this app and make it work better for your devices, also you really need to test your bot firmware updates before pushing them because they are causing machines to brick out!

title: AWFUL! DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME
text:
We have had the Botvac D5 for a few months and where do I even begin. Let’s start with my current problem. The bot wouldn’t run off of my APP anymore-a common problem. So I emailed the support team. Well don’t expect immediate chat responses. The guy took 10 minutes at times to respond and then had no idea where we were. He reset my password when I had asked him not to. Then he said to delete the app and power down the bot...so I did...well now I can’t get my bot to connect. I then told the guy my WiFi wasn’t popping up on the app...none of the WiFi’s in the APP were and he had NO CLUE what was going on. It has now been over a month I can’t get the app to work nor the bot to connect to my phone so now it’s this worthless thing collecting dust.

When I press the button to run it, it gets stuck, rarely returns to home base (and guess what if you move it, it’s not very smart and keeps getting stuck again), and doesn’t even clean all of my rooms.

Save yourself the hassle and invest in a different one-this program, their staff, is not worth your sanity.

title: Unstable
text: I’ve had my Neato and have been using the app for about a year now. The app is terribly unstable. NOT what you would expect from a company that charges so much for their products. The only thing the app needs to do is talk to Neato and start cleaning and probably 30% of the time I get stuck on an error screen that says “App update required”. Every time this happens there is no app or phone update to perform. I’ve written into support and they gave me a bunch of troubleshooting steps that you normally prescribe to buggy software - log in/log out, restart phone, toggle some system settings, and here’s the best one - repair the robot. Due to the stability problems in the app, pairing the robot is a really long and painful process. It’s the last thing I want to do and honestly I’m not even 100% confident the app would work well enough to do it. Please Neato, get this app in better shape. I want to love it but it’s so hard!

title: Love this robot, have a few app issues
text:
I love my Neato. I recommend one to everyone I talk to. It’s amazing and life changing. It cleans so well, it does an amazing job, far better than I do cleaning. I thought I would be replacing myself sweeping but it’s so much more. I’ve never done as good a job sweeping and vacuuming as my Neato does. 
I get messages that my robot is stuck and needs to be moved A LOT. I’m not talking about when the robot is working. That’s understandable. I get these messages when the robot is charging on its base. Over and over it will send a message that it’s stuck and would I please move it.
I also wish I could command the robot to return to its base from my phone. There appears to be an option in the app that says “dock” but it is always greyed out. If I have to stop the robot mid clean or move it from another room, I would like to be able to tell it to go dock itself.

title: Great Bot!  App now doesn’t stay connected
text: Like others here, I am super psyched with my Neato. Great vacuum!  I’ve had him over a year and he’s still going strong, but a couple months ago, after one of my app upgrades, I noticed he was going “offline” fairly often. I followed the instructions and reset and that would work...for a few days.  Rinse. Repeat.  After my next update, I thought it would improve. Nope. Now I will reset and he’ll reconnect (usually) and I run him and after he docks, he’s offline again. I haven’t had a logged cleaning on my app since July even though I run him (usually manually now) three times a week. I’ve deleted and reinstalled the app. No joy. I reset the poor little guy all the time and it doesn’t help. Soooooo... hoping the next update fixes this as I love my vacuum and thought the app was great back when it worked like it was supposed to. (And yes, like the others, my WiFi signal is strong)

title: Good Vac, Lousy App
text:
We have a D4 and it’s a great vac when it works. The app, however, is a mess. Confusing UI and weird menu organization aside, it just has constant problems connecting to WiFi - I’ve seen plenty of folks describing similar problems to the ones we’ve had. 

Once my phone is on the D4’s WiFi, it’s a crapshoot whether the app will be able to connect the botvac to our home WiFi. Most times I have to manually enter our WiFi SSID, and most of the time that means the Botvac won’t be able to connect. It just hangs on the naming screen. 

One time, there was an actual list of available networks, like there’s supposed to be! It was wild, man. Most of the time there isn’t, and most of the time it can’t connect. So we beat our heads against it for an hour and eventually, it works. It’s a huge waste of time and it feels like inevitably it’ll just stop working entirely. 

We’re on our second D4 after returning the first one, and are having a similarly bad experience. Everything about the app seems destined to be abandoned and left un-updated by the developers, but our expensive (and again, otherwise good!) Botvac needs the app to properly operate. 

Neato, please put more resources into your app! We really want to keep using and endorsing your products but you’re making it difficult.

title: App update required? !
text: The app, when it works is pretty cool.  But it’s super frustrating when it doesn’t.  Like now, both me and my wife haven’t been able to log in for weeks now.  Our robot has gone on working, but we have no control over it because we can’t log in.  I finally got enough time to sit down and investigate and apparently I need to update the app because I’m seeing an “app update required” message now that I’ve wiped out my old assword that my phone, my wife’s phone, my iPad, my wife’s iPad all used.  Argh!  Every device I used to log in has been locked out and my username/password no longer work for no apparent reason.  Finally, today, I was able to manually re-enter the u/p and get the app loaded.  Ok, so now how do I update the app?  I came to this page and I have no “update” option…just (open).   So now what???   So frustrating!

title: Good products but this app is sub par
text:
This is a very good company and they make very good products. I have the Botvac D4 Connected and it’s a nice little machine. As it should be, this review is regarding the app NOT the product for which it controls. 

The interface of this app is not the most intuitive. The main screen has a lot of blank space that could be used for displaying a map or some more useful information than whether my vacuum is cleaning or charging. To access information you must tap on tiny glyphs to reveal pop-ups. In my opinion all of this information could be easily displayed on the main screen in real time. Additionally the main screen could be used to display current floor plan and or schedules for cleaning. It is a very nice looking app but the user interface could definitely do with some redesign.

title: Saves me hours a week
text:
Waited for years to buy one of these. $500 for a robot vacuum when I already had central vacuum seemed silly.  After living with it for 2 months, it was waiting that was silly.  My saved time is well worth $500.  In fact I may buy a second one so I can stop carrying up and down stairs.  

I have one complaint: before the last update my D5 worked and interacted with app flawlessly.  After the update it does not interface with app well anymore, often is unavailable or sends false alert messages, and it also now seems to wander more and lose its place, unable to find its base.  If these are bugs from the update I hope they’ll fix them. 

But honestly, the app is really secondary.  The robot works great and id buy another one even if they don’t fix the app.

title: Horrible experience, the robot is always giving error messages of "I'M stuck"
text: This is definitely not what I paid for, I have hardwood floors with a few bathroom rugs, this robot can't navigate without getting stuck and requiring me to move it two feet and restart which screws up the mapping function, and it has NEVER been able to do a run around the house in order for me to establish virtual barrier lines. Extremely disappointed that in two months and moving all items from around my house that would interfere with the vacuum it has only ONCE completed a full cycle without me having to pick it up and walk it back to the docking.  False advertising on the navigation skills of this robot, and the app is pretty limited and useless for what you want to do.   If your vacuum gets stuck and you move the device two feet away and try and "return to dock" it just spins around the same room and never navigates back towards the room where the dock is.

title: Very Good - Few tweaks to be great
text:
I really like the D7 we purchased for Christmas - the hardware is great. The app is good but could use some minor enhancements - which admittedly won’t apply to everyone due to their particular model of Vac. In regards to the zone cleaning feature, it would be nice to have a polygon tool to draw the zone rather than just a rectangle.  Also it would be nice to be able to select multiple zones to clean during one run before coming back to its dock. Thirdly- please add a polygon tool, ellipse, and rectangle tool for the no-go lines. A layer that you could toggle on/off for the no-go lines would be nice so you don’t have to recreate them if you wanted to temporarily remove them would be great. 

All and all a very nice product. Keep on improving and I’ll keep showing my friends and selling more.

title: Great Robot performance, mediocre Software which just ruins the experience.
text: The robot cleaning performance is five star. No complaints in regards to the robots performance because it works better than expected at maintaining a house floor debris free if used correctly. I run it daily with minimal over head just the occasional sweeping out corners and large objects. The stability and navigation of the APP is a whole different thing. Unfortunately since this is the way users interact with the robot it ruins the experience. The maps and features don’t always work, if you stop the robot it doesn’t always give you the option to dock. There are icons on the screen that are confusing because you can neither click them to do anything or provide information. The options for cleaning rarely work and you constantly have to redo maps.  🤦🏽‍♂️

title: Need lots of improvements
text:
Purchased Neato D7 this thanksgiving season and all our excitement vaporized when we started using the app. 

The App took  several attempts to connect the Neato to our home WIFI. Finally somehow magically it did connect, then we were prompted to update Neato’s software and that took several attempts ... app just couldn’t download the software or initiate the upgrade.

Next ordeal came in terms of setting up the floorplan. Neato got stuck at several places and there was no way for us to use the partial cleaning map to put the NO-GO lines.. it was like babysitting your robot to not get stuck. Our floor is about 1500 sq ft so it couldn’t finish mapping the floor in first charge and went back to base to recharging for couple of hours and then Restarted back in midnight and got stuck again.. had to Wakeup to unstuck...

With frustration we stopped the neato as it was 1:00 am. Morning when thought to resume it has lost all the cleaning details and again had start from beginning!

Just couldn’t understand why cant use partial maps to start putting no go line and as it keep cleaning keep updating the map.

Looks like Neato app as well as Neato software needs major improvement

title: Great but room for improvement
text: Now that customer support helped me to finally complete a floor plan (had to send additional magnetic strips), this thing is a life-changer!  BUT... a really easy fix would be to make a mode where you can create a floor plan without the actual suction on; just walk the home.  Our 1-story has a very large footprint.  Plus, they need to allow “breadcrumbs” so that it can always find its way to the dock, even when not using a floor plan.  Also, would be nice to view stats (like rooms we tend to clean more than others or ones that haven’t been cleaned for a while).  Finally, I don’t think you can use Alexa to clean just a specific room (I could be wrong, tho).  Look forward to even more!

title: Please fix major problems before releasing any other new vacuums
text:
When will the no-go lines software update  be pushed through to the Botvac Connected? My robot vacuum makes it back to base about 10% of the time, and that’s after hiding all my cords, placing barriers, and buying extra/placing the thick black strips all over my home. I’m no longer bothered that it makes my wood floors look like they’re held together by duct tape. For $700, I would expect software updates to be ongoing. I bought the $700 robot about 8 months ago and now it’s outdated. Is spending another $800 the only way to get this update? I also would be interested in getting the docking button to work in the app or through voice. It’s frustrating that the button is there but always disabled. So many of the defects defeat the purpose of a robot vacuum. 

I would caution anyone from buying a new Neato vacuum, given the lack of ongoing support for improving the problems facing  current customers.

title: App is terrible
text: While the vacuum lives up to the Neato name and does an excellent job cleaning, the app is cumbersome and faulty.  The initial setup was very difficult even for an experienced computer network technician. That said, once I finally got it connected, any time I want to control the robot I have to disconnect my phone from the WiFi the robot is connected to in order to find the robot. That makes no sense but it works. Yes, the robot is connected to my home WiFi but I control it using my cellular data signal. It does work remotely though meaning I can start the robot from anywhere as long as I have a phone service. Recently, the system fails to load the cleaning map when the robot goes to run its scheduled cleaning and I have to manually intervene and restart the process repeatedly before it will clean the house. Very frustrating. Probably look somewhere else for my next robot.

title: Love my new room decor
text: It’s nothing but a docking station robot that collects dust. Works great when I first set it up and have it learn my layout...then I add the virtual no go lines and when I want it to vacuum again...the app gives me an error that I’m on a different floor plan. Weird how I’ve now used Velcro to secure the base station down to assure that it doesn’t move at all...completely erase the robot from the app and reload it. Again...works awesome to learn my floor plan again and after it’s done I load the virtual lines and bam...same app error again saying that I’m on the wrong floor plan. I guess I can’t use the virtual floor plan no go lines??? The vacuum will not work on high pile rugs so the no go lines are a must to avoid this area. I now have an expensive dust collector that’s completely useless. I highly suggest lighting your money in fire and watching it burn then buying one of these.

title: Used to work - Not anymore
text:
My D4 was WiFi connected and working great. Overnight something went wrong. Now, bot won’t connect and app is “frozen”. Can’t connect and app doesn’t respond. Great when it works, but requires a lot of time and attention to keep it connected. Thought I was past the stage of initial setup, but seems as I am always having to repeat the process. Right now I can’t get it to work. Disappointed.

Spent hours trying to connect and finally succeeded. Connection is currently stable. Wondering how long this will last because troubles occur when software and firmware are updated, which happens frequently (too frequently). Neato support team is helpful, but developers need to do better. Purchased Neato vac to save time and energy not to spend hours trying to connect.

title: App needs constant attention
text: I have been using for a couple of months and have almost constant problems with the app. The support was helpful when I used them, it seems to resolve most issues you need to delete the device and then add back in. Just had the vacuum stop midway through routine saying it was lost, it was in the middle of a wide open area near our router. Finally had to turn off, then would not reconnect so had to delete the device to get to reconnect. This is at least the fourth time In two months I have had to do this, seems excessive maintenance is required. I am getting good at doing this however I don’t have to do this for other devices that I run. When the vacuum completes the program it works well on the cleaning.

title: Neato robot vac
text: I’ve had the Neato D3 now for about 3 months.  Have not experienced any issues in reviews posted. It learned my floor plan in 3 cleanings. Setup no go lines after it learned floor plan and made that feature available to me. Now with no go lines cleans entire 1st floor in one charge. Initially it spent a lot of time around bar stools but no go lines solved that.  It’s even able to go under coaches. We use it supervised although it has not had issues so it could be scheduled.  Picks up a lot of dog hair which keeps us from doing a up right cleaning to 3-4 times a month. We primarily use it as supplemental cleaning for dog hair.  Highly pleased with purchase and unit and app.

title: Great Features, could be improved
text:
The app works wonderfully. Push alerts let me know when the cleaning has completed (which reminds me to empty the filter). 

The initial setup went smoothly, however the app should have prompted me to do the “special floor plan creation” for using the No-Go lines on the FIRST cleaning. Because it doesn’t prompt for this I let it clean the entire house thinking I would then be able to draw no-go lines, which is not the case. So after waiting hours for it to finish I had to repeat the process in the special mode. 

I also wish in the scheduled cleaning section I could specify the cleaning options such as: whole home, specific room(s) and eco, or turbo modes. So I could set certain days for eco and other days for turbo mode in select areas.

title: Love my R2D2 ♥️
text: Received my Neato as a mother’s day gift from my son 4 years ago. As a mom “ who has everything”(according to him 😀) he always tries to give me something unique that I would not buy for myself. At first I was a lil skeptical, BUT after one run, my hardwood floors were spotless. Better than any vacuum cleaner I’ve ever owed. My Dalmatian coat is extremely course and hard to pick up but R2D2 grabbed it up like a boss! And the app is extremely easy to use so you can set up cleaning options. Set it and forget it! I’m very impressed with the technology this robot has. Have to say, it’s my all time favorite gift! (So far) ♥️🤖

title: This is an app review, not a device review
text: I’ll begin by highlighting the fact, I love my Neato D6.  It’s the bomb.  But the app is another story.  It could stand some improvement.  It’s not particularly user-friendly.  Once you get the hang of it, things make a kind of sense, but I would love to see more function and less white space.  I’d like to see the progress of my D6 while it’s cleaning instead of when the cycle is finished.  The machine got stuck and needed assistance, but the message simply flashed across my screen and was gone.  If I hadn’t been holding my phone I would have missed the fact the cleaning cycle was cancelled.  Surely you guys can write a better app for such a great product.

title: Unacceptable
text:
Like other users, I’ve had serious problems with connectivity. You need to fix your app, when the software doesn’t work it severely handicaps the hardware. I’m seeing similar reviews about this app from 2 years ago so my hopes aren’t high that it will actually be fixed.
I contacted customer service and while they were friendly, after a few troubleshooting questions they asked for me to download a third party app called RouteThis to scan my network settings. Reviews on the third party app sounded sketchy so I didn’t use it. In the end, I changed the battery and reset my 2.4ghz WiFi settings (which was a headache because a lot of other devices use this network and none are anywhere as finicky as Neato) and it still doesn’t work. I wish I could return this bot but it was a gift.

title: I wish I could go back in time
text: First of all, i am pleased with the robot (D7) performance for the first 6 months. Then I bought another exact same model for my other floor, and that where the disaster happened. The botvac kept failing to connect to wifi and extremely PIA to reconnect them back to your wifi network. Some wifi router features such mesh network, fast roaming, beamforming... prevent the botvac to stay connected with the wifi . Tech support aware of the problem and admitted there is no fix. They suggested me to disable those wifi feature on your router, and STAY AWAY form your neibour wifi signal (because they may have those features turned on and interfere your botvac). Seriously? Now i am stuck with 2 pieces of dust collector. I paid $600/each for this botvac.... I wish I went with irobot brand.

title: Works great! When it works.....very frustrated!!!!!!!!
text: After being prompted to update, the vacuum has not worked right. Sometimes it cleans on its schedule, sometimes it does not clean at all, and it rarely cleans my whole floor plan. I tried setting up the floor plan in the hopes of it cleaning like it used to, but nope. It made a new floor plan after cleaning only half of my home. It has turned out to be a nuisance instead of helping. My emails to Customer Care have gone unanswered, and I dread another lengthy phone call. I had to add a robot to even get this one clean, after the update.I wish I could go back and undo the update as it caused even more issues for me...I am not happy with Customer Service at all, especially since they list the email on their support  page, and then don’t respond.

title: Everyone has 2.4 & 5 GHz radios active nowadays. This should be a prerequisite in your test plan.
text:
App specifically:
I’ll be nice and just say the app is subpar. Help kicks you out to their poorly-formatted webpage. Ability to change frequency of reminders would be extremely helpful, otherwise they are not really applicable.

Interaction with D7 hardware:
Have a surfboard modem/router. I have specified by MAC address that the D7 should always connect to 5GHz radio so it’s on the same network as my iPhone and Google Home-connected devices. Still have to do the darn soft reset once every week or two because the app doesn’t register what the vacuum is doing. Always thinks it is “ready” even when it’s currently running, or “charging.” There is no “vacuuming” status?

title: Neato D70 is a paper weight at its best
text: The whole reason for buying a botvac was to make mine and my girlfriends life easier. We constantly quarreled about who would vacuum. Lo and behold Neato comes out with its D70 that  promises to put an end to all our vacuum related quarrels. The good news, we no longer quarrel about vacuuming, bad news we now quarrel over who will reset the neato and have it reconnect to the app/WiFi. In fact, I am writing this review as I try to reconnect my neato which is stuck on the ‘name your robot’ screen. I am probably doing this 3 times a week sometimes more. This does not include the random times the neato disconnects from my WiFi and decides to connect back for no reason at all. I also have a Roomba i7+ which cost just as much but delivers better cleaning, an app that just works and self emptying. This was my first neato and probably my last as well.

title: Unable to pair robot
text:
This is feedback on the app, specifically WiFi pairing. It is the worst experience imaginable. I have a number of smart home devices, WiFi 6 with a strong signal and I am unable to pair the robot. Followed all instructions, connect to robot access point and then it just stalls. Is Neato going out of business or why are they letting this app slip? They should fire their entire networking team.

Update: Neato customer support was very friendly in trying to resolve the issue but ultimately uncalable. The robot never paired with my iPhone. I tried the same procedure on my iPad and it worked. Great until the robot (high end D7 model) forgot the wife credentials and I am back to square one. Highly frustrating. Neato needs to stop advertising smart with features since they do not work reliably.

title: Could use a bit more, but overall good
text: I don't see why the app has so many bad reviews. After a week of use, I haven't had any problems so far. I do think the app could be improved a bit. The app is missing a few features that even a $200 wifi enabled competitor has. And, and this actually bothers me, why did they choose Shop and Help as the 3D touch toggles?! Wouldn't a Start and Pause 3D touch toggle be so much more useful?! Anyway, the app works alright and gives me most of the necessary info, but please give me better 3D touch toggles (that work with No-Go lines) and maybe add a Do not Disturb, or even the option to turn off the sounds on the robot.

title: Work in progress
text:
We love our Neato vacs, and think it’s a great company. However, this review is about the app and not the performance of the unit itself.

First, why no landscape mode? My impression of apps that don’t rotate is the developer is being either lazy, or not considering where/how the app will be used. Not real smart for a home use item. How about supporting IPAD users!

Next, can you please make the icon buttons even smaller? That way everyone will need a magnifying glass to see them. I’m being sarcastic of course, they are too small, and in most screens there’s plenty of open screen for better, larger icons.

Finally, there is nothing really intuitive about the layout. You just have to poke around through different menus to find what you’re looking for. Please consider reworking the menu structure so you only have one layer.

You’ve certainly improved the app in the year I’ve been using it, and I do like the functionality that has been added. I appreciate that, but don’t think the lower models should have their software limited, as the functionality is not worth the extra cost of the unit.

title: Sad this doesn’t work for the money
text: First world problem, yes. But when a customer pays the amount they do for a product, they expect all parts to work correctly, which in this case is a faulty app. I’ve had my Neato D5 for just over a year now. Things worked great in the beginning, then one day after an update, she would no longer connect to the app. Yes, the robot still worked. But to be able to set a schedule, know where she had cleaned, be able to find her if she got stuck and to be able to tell her to go home, was all gone. Yes, I got spoiled. Yes, I spent months and countless emails and phone calls with Neato support. But that was about 4 months ago and I frankly, just gave up. I hope there can be a resolution soon but doesn’t look like it. Once this robot bites the dust, I will most likely look to another brand based on reviews.

title: Worked for a week.
text: Like the other reviewer, the vacuum cleaner is great. That app, not so much.  It was actually working pretty great for about a week, for whatever reason that we still don’t know, anything we did inside the app just confused to the vacuum cleaner. Often it would go into my bedroom and do two lines and go back to the base and then tell me that it’s finished cleaning. We used the app to get it started and it sat 12 inches from the base “paused” for no good reason. Didn’t touch anything in the app. My older son who is a tech geek worked with it all week trying to figure out the bug. We have resorted to deciding to take it back today. Again, when the vacuum cleaner is working it is wonderful. The app seems to be the issue.

title: Great app, and robot, sometimes difficult though
text: I recently received a d5 connected for Christmas, and I love it! But the app needs some slight improvement. My robot continuously loses its connection with WiFi, and it takes a while to reconnect it. Other than that, I absolutely love the robot in general!! It picks up just about anything I throw at it, including expired dry macaroni farm animal shapes!! I wish it had the automatically cleaning brushroll like the new shark iq robot, if you could add that in a future version of the robot!! Thanks for the awesome robot, it really helped my mom and dad a lot!! Also my grandmother bought one for herself, the d3, and she loves hers as well!! Thank you for your support!!

title: Works ok
text: I’ve had a D3 connected for about a year now. It has been working reasonably well running 3 days a week by schedule. It picks up an enormous amount of dog hair after our daughters dog visits for a day or two. No issues with my IOS13 update but just downloaded the vacs new firmware update today. Hope it plays well. The floor mapping feature is the best because now it doesn’t get hung up on things (shag carpet, etc) by simply drawing a line on the scanned house map to keep it from that area. However, the app is poorly laid out and should be cleaned up. But, it does work well with my Apple Watch and sends me the finished house map after it has completed vacuuming!

title: Great app, great vacuum
text: I don’t even know where to start with the vacuum, this thing is amazing (botvac D5 connected). But since this is a review for the app, I’ll talk about that. So far it’s worked flawlessly. Seriously, what else do you want in a robot vacuum app? The only thing I can recommend, which is probably extremely difficult from a programming standpoint, is to be able to zoom in on the map and draw keep out zones that your robot then obeys on subsequent cleanings (that way you wouldn’t have to use the magnetic strip). That would be awesome! Overall, buy a neato, don’t waste your time with any other robot vacuum.

title: Decent app, amazing bots
text:
Neato obviously has some great hardware and software engineers for their robotics, but they need a new UI team badly. My two bots (D5 and D3) have hundreds of hours of use and several years in show no signs of stopping. Our house is constantly dog hair and dirt free. Plus we keep getting new features, like mapping and virtual no go lines.

However, the app UI leaves much to be desired. Changing robots isn't intuitive (why wouldn't a home page adapt to show multiple bots if you have more than one) and setting no go lines is a comedy.

Neato better invest in UI/UX soon or the advantages they have on the technical side will be matched by others with a better human interface.

title: Get a roomba
text: They’ve left these products dead in the water. Absolutely unacceptable. If the developer would like to respond with an actual plan of updates moving forward, cool. Let’s hear them. Ever notice how they don’t respond to any posts about how the app hasn’t been updated in OVER A YEAR? I work in tech. This app, and any products from the d7 backward are DEAD and will just slowly die off. You all used to be top of the game. I used to rave to everyone about how awesome Neato was compared to literally every single other robot vacuum. But this? Leaving your customers who got you were you are with a dead app and no updates? Not acceptable. You sold out, and stopped innovating. It shows. I’ll come running back when it has an auto-empty bin, and actual customer support.

title: Love this little thing!
text:
I adore this vacuum. I’m a busy mom of 3 kids and I’m so tired with all the chores. Would much rather be doing fun things with/without my kids. I also own my own business and have an employee so I really am busy! 
The only thing I do now for my floors is pick up the house and my kids do 85% of that. The robot takes care of the rest. I have hardwood floors throughout the house and only 2 area rugs for carpet and the vac cleans great on both surfaces. Once a month I do get the corners and it really just depends but the botvac is quite good. 

No issues with the app. It works! My vac stays connected etc. I just wish there were more features. Mapping the home to tell the vac which room to do first. My vac always runs out of battery before it’s done and sometimes I want the dirtiest room in the house cleaned first. I don’t want to wait 2 hrs. So I really wish there was some way to direct it rather than the self drive feature. 

Overall I love it!

title: D3 has no support
text:
ETA: after seeing the reply from Neato - are you saying that your still updating this app? I do not have a connection issue. When opening the app it states to update. There is no update. Given everyone here is experiencing the same issues, I don’t think *I* have the problem. LET ME UPDATE THE APP SO I CAN USE YOUR PRODUCT CORRECTLY. 

I love my vacuum. Having an older product - that still works well (maybe it shouldn’t and I got a dud in Neatos mind) should mean that I still get app support. I can no longer update this app for D3, and now it’s telling me to “update app” to even use the start/stop/dock functions. Yes I can push the button to make it go…but that’s not the point. Is it really that hard to make a app still work? How about you just stop the update prompts?

title: My floor plan has NOT changed
text: The app is SUPER picky about anything moving and your vacuum will not run. I cannot run my Neato without the no go lines, I need it to stay away from cord and cables. But I can’t tell you how many times it says my flor plan does not match and I need to make a new one. Just about every time I run the Botvac D7 it says my floor plan does not match even though everything is in the same place. So the botvac starts up then goes back to the base. Funny thing is if I try to add a new app it says “wait this new map is too similar to an existing one”. Really? Because you didn’t recognize it as matching when I tried to actually vacuum. Please PLEASE add a button or option that says “override, floor plan is the same”.

title: I’m frustrated
text:
I keep losing wi-fi connection 
I have a strong signal, but it connects for a second, tells me it is not a secure network then disconnects. 
I thought it was me, but after seeing all the reviews with the same issue, I realize it’s the vac. 
How do I fix this. I bought this because I have major issues with my back and vacuuming is not good for me 
I end up having to lean over and try to re-boot over and over again or I have to sit on the floor. 
This is a problem and I need a fix unless you folks want to buy it back from me 
When it works it’s great, but I spend way too much time trying to get it to work 
Help me please

4/24: update ~~~
Company sent me an email requesting that I go on line and look to get some help. 
Live Chat does not work! Okay I’ll send an email- oh wait email request won’t work. Notes that I can’t leave a line blank. It’s not blank! The category I selected is Connecting. 
I spent a lot of money for this and I can’t even get it to work by just pushing the on button. 
It’s such a nice decoration in my house, because it sure doesn’t work. 
Don’t waste your money!!!

title: Crashes when not connected to same Wi-Fi
text:
When I try using the manual drive mode it tells me to connect to the same WiFi as my robot. At this point my app crashes and I have to re open it. 
The problem I have with this is not just the app crashing, but I have the multiple WiFi access points with different SSIDs that are all on the same network. I connect my phone onto one ssid and my robot on another and technically I should still be able to control the bot because I am on the same network.
Last issue I have is the dock option is rarely available. I should be able to select it at any time and my robot should go in search of the dock.

title: Much Improved.
text: We love our little D7 so much better now that you added the zones to the app.  We can tell it to vacuum one area at a time when before it had to do the whole house. And it never vacuumed the rooms in the same order.  Some times it would not vacuum an area and say it was complete.  I wish you could pick the areas you wanted vacuumed in a certain order instead of individually.  It still forgets to vacuum part of my kitchen.   Setting up the D7 was a little confusing the first time but I figured it out. The end result is the house gets vacuumed more than it it would with a lot less stress.

title: Floor plans
text:
Brand new robot D7
After set up I am trying to add no go lines.  It keeps saying Something has gone wrong

Support gave me steps but nothing works

Every change I make shows on the App but it won’t update the robot.

Suggestions to app

Trying to add no go lines is difficult
As you zoom in and draw the screen moves.
It should not move as I am drawing

They also need shapes.  Like draw a square, rectangle, circle.

Adding lines as the join should connect and a grid option should be made to say something like connect to grid lines.  

Otherwise , it works well and picks up a lot.

Lastly, when it does get stuck, I want a find me button that when pressed sounds an alarm or beep to the bot.  Battery out should still allow the beep to work like adding a 9 volt battery for alarm

This way I can find it when it gets stuck in a place not easily visible.  One time it was in a closet behind the clothes.  It took as an hour.. it hides well in a game of hide in seek.

title: 5 stars when it works
text: I have to remove and reconnect this app about 2 times a month. I have the D7, which cleans like a champ. I love using the app to send the robot into a room, schedule, or set no-go lines. But connection is frustrating. I cannot use this on my phone or WiFi for setup connection. I have to use my phone’s hotspot, then connect with my iPad to the 2.5 hotspot. Once it is connected, I can direct it from my phone app with the IPad serving as its connector. No-Gos are the primary reason to buy the advanced robot, but if you cannot use the app...?

title: Great robot, app basics work but could use improvements
text: I love my D7 robot, but the app is missing some features and I ran into a few bugs during setup. While Siri shortcuts is a nice addition, when the robot is from a shortcut it always starts on the eco power setting and there is no way to change it into power as far as I can tell. I’ve also never been able to manually drive the robot even though it’s on the same wifi network as my phone, I’d also like to see the ability to start a cleaning in multiple zones but not the whole floor-plan, and landscape mode on an iPad.

title: Unfinished app with lots to be desired
text: Very basic app with limited capabilities that do not allow to use all the robot features. Some examples. There is no go home button, only stop and go.  If you stop it in the middle there is no way to tell it go back to the charging base. The no-go lines are a great idea but the setting and editing process are a chore. To set it up you need to let the robot scour the entire floor even if a previous map of the same floor is already established. If you want to edit the no-go lines you need to start a new map from scratch, having the robot vacuuming the entire floor again, you cannot edit existing lines nor add new lines or remove old ones.

title: Buggy, barely works.
text: I haven’t been able to connect my robot to Wi-Fi for four months since I moved, support was not helpful, company does not offer phone support, app is barely ever updated. App throws maddening error messages as you try to connect to Wi-Fi and frequently fails or simply refreshes without displaying any message at all. Company will not even talk to you over the phone “because Covid.“ Without the app, the robot has no scheduling, no floorplans, none of the features I paid for. While it’s true that Roombas are significantly more expensive and have fewer “features“ the fact that they do in fact support their products for quite some time, and effectively, makes their product the winner.

title: Overall very happy
text:
Bought a used Neato D6 off Craigslist for $200 and have had it for ~3 months now cleaning 3x/week. It has been exceptionally effective in my 720 SQF hardwood and carpeted apartment. Very smart! 

The app has been everything I need it to be. A lot of reviews say the Neato has issues with disconnecting from WiFi/ the app but I have not experienced that. Even when our Wifi went down the Neato reconnecting process took about 3 minutes. 

Overall very happy! Neato does a great job.

title: Not so excited any more!
text: Loved it when I first got it. Then it would just stop in the middle of cleaning, appeared confused at times like it doesn’t know where it should be cleaning, goes over the same area multiple times. Considering returning it!  Update: Neato replaced the unit with a brand new one that I have now had about two weeks maybe three weeks. Ever since the last update it will not work at all, it constantly says empty the dirt bin and there is nothing in the dirt bin. I have vacuumed it, I’ve cleaned it, I’ve done everything. I’ve even taken the battery out and left it out for two hours and reset it and reconnected to Wi-Fi about three or four times, it still will not work. I have sent their support team and email - I want my money back!!

title: My Bot
text:
Neato keeps getting better and better! This app is awesome and very handy! I use it all the time to start or pause or even return him to his base. Though he is very diligent about going back by himself when he needs to recharge. I especially love being notified if the bin becomes full. 
On my first Neato, I had a prob with WiFi & Customer Service quickly replaced my bot and it’s been heaven ever since. 
*Note* For those Engineering types - don’t try to watch your bot and figure out his efficiency method, it will drive you crazy! It’s just magic!

title: App is fine, has DST bug
text:
No major complaints with the app, works pretty well. 
I did find what I'd consider a bug. I was changing my robot's weekend schedule to have it run earlier in the day (6:30 AM). Saturday was changed correctly but Sunday was changed to 7:30 AM due to DST. Not only did it display 7:30 AM, but this is also the time it ran on Sunday. I don't think that makes sense as expected behavior. I want 6:30 AM regardless of DST. Clearly I can now fix it to the right time so not a big deal, but would be cool if they fixed this.

title: Horrible App
text: This is the worst app I have ever tried to work with. It’s useless. I run my Neato every day and I have gotten the app to connect with the Neato only a handful of times. I end up having to go press the button on the Neato manually or ask my Alexa device to run Neato. My Neato can be running and the app will still say it’s offline, though it’s not as I was able to get Alexa to run it and it shows up on my WiFi devices as connected. It has mapped its run on the app exactly once, and only partially. The app is more headache than it’s worth. PLEASE FIX IT! Your Neato device is great but your app needs to function in order to compete with other robotic vacuums out there. There’s so much more your users could be getting out of your product with a functioning app.

title: D3 Connected
text:
I purchased my Neato D3 Connected Botvac a little over a year ago & it was one of the BEST purchases I’ve ever made. 🙌🏻
It saves me so much time! It cleans my home very well (we have several animals). If I could rate the botvac itself, I would give it 4.5/5 stars! It does get stuck sometimes & the battery life could be improved but other than that it’s an amazing product! 

The app is a little disappointing at times. It loses connection with WiFi often, despite it being close to the router. 

Future update recommendations: 
1. It would be helpful to see how far the robot has cleaned the floor plan while it’s cleaning the house to judge where it is during its cleaning cycle. 
2. Aesthetically the app needs redesigned (some people are spending $700+ on a botvac and the app itself looks cheap). 
3. The connectivity issues need to be resolved.

I LOVE my botvac, but the app definitely has some issues & I would love to see some improvements so my botvac can run more efficiently 🙂.

title: Latest update ruined map
text:
Have had the D7 model for a few weeks, setup a map on the app, no-go lines, and a schedule. Everything was FLAWLESS. Then I updated the software and app to try out the new addition of Zone cleaning. 

The update changed my schedule - well, that was odd, OK easy enough to fix. My floor plan map was still intact, so I created a Zone to test. Told it to run from the app...it stated No Floor Plan Match Found. OK, well, let's just run a regular cleaning without the Zone. Same thing, no Floor Plan found. OK, let's create a new floor plan from scratch. Same problem...now the machine is basically worthless. I'm beginning to think updating it was a huge mistake. Help me out here, Neato, this is terrible!

title: Robot Offline
text:
This is the worst IoT experiences for me. I bought the vacuum almost 8 months ago. Since then the app has never worked for me. I would connect the robot to the app and then it would show Robot Offline within every two days. I resync the robot and it would still not stay online for more than a few days. 
I worked with their support and they even sent me a free replacement bot but it has the same story. I think its the app issue and not the bot. 
They also pointed it to be a wifi issue so we played around with network ports and firewall, I also changed my wifi provider but still have same issues. 
I have given up on the app and deleted it. 
I have no issues about the Robot’s cleaning capabilities and performance.

title: Great vacuum / Great app
text:
I have a house with dark wooden floors throughout, and carpet in the bedrooms and office, has no problem navigating or cleaning.  The wooden floors portion of my house is random, and rarely do I frequent any of the bedrooms except the Master Bedroom. One suggestion would make your app perfect, would have the capability to schedule multiple zones at a time so I could take care of just a hardwood floor‘s rather than the whole house or have to go into the app one at a time. 

D7 actually cleans better than my upright Shark, takes care of cat hair, dander, and dust.

title: Great Vacuum, Poor App
text:
I will start by saying that I do really like my Neato D7. It does a great job cleaning, and when the application works the cleaning zones and virtual “no-go” lines are great features. 

However the app is very buggy. I have not been able to access my robot for the last week because it says the app needs to be updated.  When I go to the App Store it shows I have the latest version. So right now I can’t do anything with the robot which is very frustrating. 

Additionally I have had to have it remap my house 3 times because it has “forgotten” it’s floor plan.  It does sometimes get lost and  unable to return to its base as well. Usually a hard restart of the robot will fix this issue and is required about once every week or two. 

If Neato would fix the app and add a few features like multi-zone scheduling, the ability to remap a zone instead of the entire house, and the ability to remap where the base is it would easily be 5 stars.

title: Will not connect
text: Horrible app. Getting it to connect is difficult.  Update. I did get it connected through one of my WAN routers but did not do anything different from what I was doing before. I still want it to go through the other router but have not looked into it yet. Frustrating set up but besides that it has been working to expectations. Cleans good and I can’t believe how much dust it collects in our house during a short time frame!  Would be higher than 3 if it was not for the set up and lack of documentation on how it connects or what you need to do so it can communicate.  It needs a little more technical documentation.

title: Terrible App/Connectivity
text: I’m not one to normally write a review, but I’m hoping that at some point the Neato team will actually fix this awful app/connection issue!!!!! I agree with so many others in these reviews.
