I bought this vacuum and spend more time battling the “offline” issues I constantly get than it takes for me to manually vacuum my whole house with my regular vacuum. I try to run my Neato to save me time and energy with my newborn, but I constantly have to hunt it down due to it not being able to locate the base or “getting lost” and then it goes off on its own and completely falls off and loses connectivity with my app right in the middle of the cleanings. PLEASE FIX THESE ISSUES!!

title: One year ownership and counting.
text:
I bought my Neato on January 4, 2019.  It has been a champ. I use it everyday to clean my whole house (2,200 sq ft). It took awhile to get it to connect to WiFi but once connected it worked great, especially with the no go lines.

About 8 months after buying the side brush stopped working. Sent it in cost free and received it back. Brush worked for about 4 months and stopped again. Sent it back cost free, and this time it worked for 3 days. Sent it back cost free and was surprised to receive a brand new one as a replacement!

Setting up the new one was flawless. Set up no go lines after initial cleaning. I believe this one is a lot better than the old one. Thank you Neato. You have a very satisfied customer.

By the way, I have referred many of my church members to buy this vacuum.

title: Saves time. Take care of it and it will take care of you
text:
I’m using the D4 and it connects flawlessly to my home internet and app. Have had no issues with it. 

Pros: 

No go lines are very accurate and help save our nice carpets from wear and tear of bristles (neato is the only robot vac with this functionality out of the box. Didn’t love the idea of having to buy extra towers and make sure the batteries were replaced every few months, especially with young kids who would knock the towers down anyway). 

Vacuums up dry food/ dog hair really well. 

Will go back to it’s spot each time without trouble, and if it runs out of battery prior to completing the cycle, it will charge then go back to where it was to finish. 

Cons:

Have to empty the bin out after each time you run it. Also, have to make sure all hair and debris is out of the bristle area each time.

title: Always get navigation error.
text: I have been trying since I got my robot to get it to clean my house on a regular basis and it’s always having issues. I have been in contact with support so many times trying to sort these issues. They even sent me a new robot and I still continue to have issues. I’ve tried making née floor plans moving the base. Everything they’ve told me I’ve tried 4 times. sad really after spending so much money on the D7 I would better to spend more and have a better product. Well I guess not going by the other reviews. I’m picking my robot is having software issues but  running the latest app so not sure what else to try

title: Good, but........
text:
If I didn’t have to keep reconnecting the vac I would be much happier. Cleans great when it’s online. Just can’t keep it online. Also have problems getting the vac to seat itself on the charger. If the connections aren’t perfect, it doesn’t charge.

Based on experiences this past week, I’ll have to drop my star rating from 3 to 2. This thing won’t stay connected, and it seems to have an aversion to its own charging base. No matter how the bot is seated at the base, it won’t charge. What gives? I reconnected the bot yesterday (again), but this morning it lost connection (again). Now, I can’t even turn the thing on to reconnect it. Really expensive dust collector at this point.

title: Good vacuum useless app
text:
The vacuum itself works well, minus the scratches it makes on wooden furniture legs (even when using its ‘extra care’ feature). The app needs improvement. 

The app does map out the entire house well. However when using the app, you have minimal control on which area to focus when sometimes you need to vacuum a specific room. This is needed when the battery runs out mid cleaning skipping out certain rooms entirely even after recharging. 

Theres also the issue of not having access to multiple users. I’d like for my partner and I both to use the app for the same vacuum.

title: Do not buy Neato D7.
text:
I have been using Neato D7 for a year and there this particular issue Neato D7 always has that just make me tell people not to buy this product.

I bought Neato D7 because one of my  fires had Neato D4 and he recommend Neato. He said he never had any issues like mine.

It works fantastically until it stops working and the Neato support team would not help.

The issue comes up with loading the floor plan and the D7 will eventually stop loading the floor plan. The only way to resolve this issue is to re-map the entire floor; however, the problem is this happens every other month.  

Neato pay attention to your customers problems, you barley have 3 stars rating and if you continue this path your customers like myself will stop using your products and will tell people not to buy Neato. 

Neato developer / engineering team, if you really care about issues with your product contact me. 
Perhaps you can help me get my $500’s worth after all.

title: Regretting Purchase
text:
I was optimistic after researching this Robot but have encountered issues that customer support could not resolve (I was told to do all of the obvious things I had already tried and spent an hour on the phone defeating the purpose of getting a robot to do the work allowing me to do other things).  It finds one spot to clean and seems to get OCD before getting confused and going back to the previously cleaned room. 

I did a hard reboot and will update after the next cleaning.

title: App keeps crashing
text: When I first started using the app and setting up zones the app kept crashing and wouldn’t open up my floor plan. I had to delete the zones and set up only a few zones so it wouldn’t crash. This was very frustrating because I don’t want to clean my whole house all at once because it takes forever. I also am disappointed that I cannot select more than one zone at a time. You can do better than this! It is working now, but I cannot customize my cleaning schedule the way I want because of the crashing issue and the app isn’t flexible enough.

title: Cool Features and Great Customer Service
text: I have the D3 Connected Botvac and am impressed with its capabilities. Why do the work when you can have a robot do it for you?  Works great for cleaning up the dirt, food crumbs and dog hair in our house. Makes going barefoot clean and worry free. There is a small learning curve to get it to perform without any snags or problems but I no longer have any issues with mine. I reached out to support for an issue I was experiencing and they were quick to resolve my concerns. I am eager to see what new features and models that Neato will release in the future!

title: This Vacuum is Awesome
text:
It’s been a year since we’ve had Walter ( our Neato). He cleans about a 3000 area, avoiding our step down family room, 8 bar stools, 8 kitchen chairs and transitions between hardwood and carpet. 

Now that Neato has maps that it draws of where he/she/it goes it would be really cool if the owner could draw lines of where the vacuum shouldn’t go. Such as our kids messy toy room. I’m sure they’ll add it.

I’ve noticed that the robot has gotten better with each software upgrade. I’m very impressed with its reliability.

title: Neato App page freezes on iPhone 6P
text:
Hi, I love the Neato 7 cleaning. However, the robot is dropping my strong WiFi signal for no reason. It is also unable to choose one among 4 WiFi signals I set up in Neato settings on the App? How about a new software upgrade? 
In addition, App page with instructions for connecting to WiFi freezes on my iPhone 6P - the back arrow in the top left corner does not respond. It requires me to delete the app and reinstall the same one from the Apple App Store and go through all the steps I had to go the very first time. How annoying! I think that the hardware is state of the art. But not the software. What a pity.

title: No power
text:
Bought this Neato because a friend has one.  Hers works great.  

I had mine powered up and ready to use.  Pushed the button and it started doing its thing.  I thought it was Bluetooth enabled and not WiFi enabled.  After a first run I configured it to run on its own dedicated WiFi.  Which it did.  Until it just stopped in the middle of the floor.  Did not need to have the bin emptied, I believe it needed to be recharged.  I returned the Neato to its base station to recharge.  Woke up this morning and there is absolutely no power to the machine. I’ve tried to power it down but it wasn’t powered to begin with.  I tried unplugging the base to no avail.  I tried to kill the WiFi setting but it doesn’t exist in my list of networks.  I’ve rebooted my phone hoping to kill the cache - if that is even necessary.

I did a simple search for support and was offered to chat with support.  After entering my info, I started the chat.  Nearly an hour ago by now.  Nobody has responded even though I am in position #1 for chat.

I would like to return this if it is going to be so finicky.

title: Best Robot Vacuum
text: I can't say enough good things about my D3. It was the only Robot vacuum in its price point to offer laser navigation. Furthermore, with the most recent update, the D3 now has multiple floor plans and no go lines, which are nice additions that Neato did not necessarily have to offer to the lower models. I very much appreciate it. Yes, I agree with other users that the app sometimes loses connection to the vacuum. However, this has improved with subsequent updates and usually not an issue.

title: Rather Good
text:
I happen to really like IoT devices that act as an AP so you can use the app over WiFi to connect the device to your home WiFi AP. And this app worked flawlessly the first time to configure the WiFi (5GHz) settings. 

The app if easy to figure out and it seems well built. The maps are excellent. I also like the bar graphs, and I’d love to see more graphs. But a few issues:

The No-Go line drawing screen should let you zoom in more. I find it hard to get the lines just where I want them. 

It’s also disappointing that the zone cleaning is limited to one zone at a time. That applies to when you schedule cleaning sessions as well.

I wish there was a comprehensive user manual available in the app, but that’s a feature request, not really an issue.

title: Useless
text: As usual an app that doesn’t work.  I have mapped my place at least a half dozen times and every time I try to use the zones or no go lines it fails. Robot will come off base about 6 inches than stops and get the infamous beep. Message no map. Make sure the base hasn’t been moved. I haven’t touched the base since I got it. I am just really tired of spending big money on electronic crap that doesn’t work as advertised. I bought this version for the no go lines and zones capability. Guess I was a fool. It would be ok if the dirt bin was bigger since I have to empty it 4 times just to get my WHOLE 1000 sf condo done.

title: Dyson my ❤️ I’d like to introduce you Neato D7, your everyday replacement 💋
text: I’m sincerely mad at myself, I bought every Dyson: V6, V8 and now on V10. I should have gotten this sooner. It’s amazing when technology actually works, is sophisticated and exceeds my expectations. Who knew I could love a vacuum more than my Dyson with a soft roller cleaner head! My V10 is now reduced to cleaning my Neato’s filter. My DIE DIE, i’ll never betray you, you’re still the best for everything above the floor, even though I need to handle you.  I love you Neato, babe, you are perfect! 😍

title: Can’t login to support
text: This app cannot log into Support on my iPhone. I went to the app because I was having a problem with my robot, but I couldn’t login. So I clicked on the Support option and it tells me to enable cookies. So I enable cookies. Then it goes to a blank page. So now I need support for the robot but also I need support for the support page but I can’t getting any support without logging in. *edit: Updated to from 1 to 3 stars as this resolved itself (both the robot and the app), and also because Support is Responsive to these reviews. Not sure how or why but it’s working now.

title: Lots of potential, but not there yet
text:
Overall, Neato has done a pretty decent job on this app. The vacuum itself is amazing, but in order to really get the most out of it, Neato really needs to up its customer facing software game. The Alexa app is sadly outdated, and the capabilities offered by this app just don’t go far enough.

The Good
- Room mapping
- No-go lines (Amazing)

The Bad
- super-buggy when it comes to actually connecting to the vacuum
- uploading rooms maps fails very often; strange bit is, why the heck does the app even need to upload maps to the vacuum?! Shouldn’t the maps be stored in the cloud and pulled down by the vacuum?
- Room specific cleaning feature is severely limited by only being able to select one room at a time. Why can’t I simply select multiple rooms at a time?
- Notifications rarely seem to work for stuck bot, fully bin, etc. I do get notifications every time the job is done, so this seems like something that should be fixed fairly easily

title: Very disorganized menu structure
text: The robot actually does a very good job cleaning so I would not want anyone to miss that point. My complaint is with the menu structure, it is very disorganized and the opposite of intuitive. I never seem to be able to figure out where to look to find the functions that I want to use. I end up stumbling around from page to page before I eventually find what I want. Getting the thing to communicate with my Wi-Fi and the Internet was no treat but it was relatively easy to call them on the phone and get the problems straightened out.

title: Could be so much better
text:
The app fails to start the vacuum 9 out of 10 times. I’m plagued by “no matching floor plan found” errors when starting the robot. I have done everything support has recommended to no avail. 

Repeatedly retrying eventually results in the robot beginning to vacuum. 

First of all, it shouldn’t be so picky. It should start up and begin cleaning for a bit to gather more info about the room before deciding the Floor plan doesn’t match. 

Second, the app should give better feedback about why it fails to start. Is it a network problem? 

Does the robot think the room/starting location changed? 

Did you open a door that was closed when it mapped the room?

Did you leave a bag on the ground that the lidar sees and now it doesn’t match? 

maybe give a live image of the lidar over the room map so the user has some clue about what’s wrong?

This thing would be 5 stars if it would reliably start and gave useful information.

title: Junk!
text: Not worth the time let alone the monetary investment. The first couple of times this thing worked brilliantly. Now it can’t find its way out of a paper bag. I can literally set the unit with in 2 inches of the base and initiate the “return to base” option,  which only seems to be available at random times, and this stupid vacuum will wander off through the house looking for its home. The vacuum will regularly get “stuck” and declare its path is blocked in the middle of a wide open hallway with nothing near it. Most frustrating piece of s#1t I mean tech ever. Work on this things AI. How hard is it for it learn where it’s base is at if it’s always in the same place. This is a hard pass. Wish I could return it.

title: Unit cost vs app quality
text: The price of this product necessitates a more polished app. Automatic vacuums are luxury items priced at a premium. The app that accompanies the product should meet the luxury item bar. I would love to see a bit more fit and finish added or at least a real-time map of where the vacuum had already cleaned. If the cost of the vacuum was cheaper I would have rated higher than one star but given the amount of money spent I don’t see how anything higher than one star is justifiable. For clarity, this rating is for the app only. Reviews of the actual vacuums and Neato customer service / warranty are better suited for other forums IMO.

title: Terrible connection
text:
The app is saying update required again?
This is the second required update in a week. Update is not automatic. Why? Technical support says “I have to uninstall then reinstall” to get the Neato app to work. Ok I did that, then the app won’t reconnect to WiFi after the update. Then they say my password for WiFi has to be changed for it has special characters. Did that and still not working! 
I had been a loyal Neato user for over 2 years, now it think I’ll look elsewhere for my bot Vac needs. I don’t recommend this app or it’s products!

title: Pretty poor...
text: I’m hoping that maybe all of this negative feedback on the app may result in an app update... we’ll see. The app start the robot but no longer recognizes that the robot us running. I’ve uninstalled and reinstalled. Paired, unpaired them repaired again. I know I they’ll tell me to contact support... and. Know it’s not going to be a quick fix, which is why I haven’t called customer support yet. Basically my complaint is that the robot and app should just work and the only thing I want to be responsible for on a regular basis is maintenance. Is that unreasonable?

title: Great UI, easy to use the no-go lines feature
text: I see a lot of negative reviews on here, but they’re from quite a long time ago. I’m happy to report that the app has a very nice, clean interface and is super easy to use. I like the layout. It’s very intuitive and smooth. I’ve had absolutely no issues using this, which I assume means they have touched up any previous problems that reviewers encountered.

title: Fantastic vacuum, great app
text:
This little D7 vacuum does everything advertised. It has enough power to clean my entire house. I use it three time a week. 

The app works very well. I can map my house and clean specific rooms that I set on the app. I can avoid areas that I “wall-off” just by dragging lines the app. I can schedule cleanings. 

This is George Jetson stuff. The connectivity issues some mention can be worked through by a 6th grader. Why would anyone complain?

title: Loses floor plans
text:
The entire point of spending extra on the d7 was for floor plans and no go lines.  When these work correctly this vacuum can’t be beat. 
However, after the last update I have to completely map out the floor plan again (yes without moving the base) and this is a huge pain as without no-go lines I have to babysit the vacuum to keep it from getting stuck and have to try multiple times before it finally gets a usable floor plan.
***changing my review down to 1 star. Neato will not recognize a floor plan more than once causing zones and no go lines not to work.  Also, I have not heard back from support on the issue.  Do not spend the money on the d7

title: Jeeves the floor saver
text: After reading multiple reviews on the Botvac D7 I decided to dive into the world of robot vacuuming. Set up was super simple and off it went to map my house. I was in awe because even though we just cleaned, the bin was SOOO full after it was done. We set an early schedule hoping to wake up to a fur free house and after looking around my family looked up to the Heavens and thanked God for Jeeves. I can’t wit for zone control!  Please keep up the cool updates.  We love this botvac!

title: Good App
text:
This app is easy to use. It was super easy to setup my bots. I love the map feature. I also like the notifications when there is something wrong, like the bot is stuck. I love that the app provides a description of the problem.

I really wish that I could change the default mode to Eco instead of Turbo, when launching the bot from the app. Turbo is a little rough on some of our rugs and I’ve been really happy with the results I get in the Eco mode. I have trouble remembering to manually switch the mode to Eco.

title: Botvac Connected
text:
I’m not sure about all those complained regarding connection problems, but I haven’t had any since owning the botvac connected model for about 8 months. Maybe it’s their WiFi or internet speed. 

I am disappointed that the double pass was taken off the updated app though. 

It would be awesome to be able to make specific boundaries in the app for the botvac. Maybe that’s an upgraded vacuum or something. All in all I would recommend the BotVac Connected. It’s saved us plenty of time.

title: Great Robots, Subpar App
text:
Sadly Neato’s App is definitely in need some of some TLC; here is why:

- Own multiple robots? There is no way to control both to conduct a manual cleaning at the same time. You must start each robot cleaning separately.

- Switching between multiple robots requires clicking a flyout (from the top) and clicking on desired unit. This could be simplified greatly by using tabs at to top of the screen instead.

- Editing schedule / Redoing floor plan is hidden in a flyout (from the left side). Despite the main screen being mostly empty / blank.

- App contains links to dead webpages; currently the button to goto the official spare parts / accessories? Takes you to a 404 page. Embarrassing.

The app works. It just feels like it wasn’t designed for simplicity / frequent use. For example, U think the flyouts are annoying when the content the hide must be frequently accessed. And fix your web links!

title: Vacuum & app are Great
text:
We love our D5 connected, “Jeeves”. I live that the app sends a map after cleaning.  Love that the app tells us where Jeeves is stuck if he needs help. After minor adjustments to make the house “robot friendly” he doesn’t get stuck hardly ever now. 
The app has a “return to base” button that seems to have 0 functionality. It stays greyed out even when we “pause” or stop the vac using the app.  If we choose to stop cleaning mid way, we should be able to use this button to return Jeeves to base.

title: Can’t control Robovac D7 thru the app any longer - App requires update
text: The app has worked fine since day 1 we got the D7 model. Just recently though I haven’t been able to start cleaning from the app, actually there’s nothing I can do there it shows a message right at the main page that “App requires update” in order to become functional once again. I got to the app store and the app is up-to-date, matter fact last version shows about a year ago. Very frustrating, can’t resolve this issue.

title: Software updates = problems
text: So far, without fail, EVERY time...and I do mean EVERY time, I update my NEATO I cannot use my robot for at least 2 weeks if at all, to the point where I joke with my wife about it..”uh oh honey NEATO wants to update, looks like it’s time for a new robot”-me. This is my second robot and I swear it is due to catastrophic software issues. Hey NEATO! Maybe test the robots with the new software before pushing out new updates to see if the updates actually work properly? I love the robot but jeez if this was a phone company it would have been out of business by now. Who ever is in charge of doing the updates needs to not be in charge of doing updates anymore...mmkay!?!

title: App is good but minor improvements
text: Like I’m sure most people do, I run my vacuum while I’m out of the house. The vacuum itself does a great job cleaning up after my husky and my Akita. Running the unit every weekday keeps the house spotless (the dust bin just needs emptied when I get home). Every once in a while the robot will get hung up though and if the ap would allow you to take manual control of the robot I think it would be better than waiting to get home to free the robot. All in all it is a great robot.

title: Love it
text: Love it!!! love the floor plan that it does. I showed all of my friends. It is much better than the other vacuum model that I had. It didn’t do corners or maneuver as well as this one does. It goes around the walls, then goes in a back and forth motion. The next time it goes in a back and forth pattern in the other direction. The other model that I had said that it would do that. But even after a week, it still looked lost.

title: Terrible app
text:
Getting it to connect to WiFi is seemingly impossible. Have deleted and restarted several times, installation just hangs. I have very good WiFi in the house. My scale connects to WiFi easier than this thing.

Update: also while trying to connect it to WiFi my monthly data usage went from 75% to 100%. Don’t know how it managed to do that.

Update: After resetting the vacuum several times, it seems to work now. Upgraded from 1 star to 3.

title: App is useless
text: I have a Botvac D5.  It is a year old and it’s been nothing but trouble.  It has already been in repair once for navigation issues and it seems it is back at it.  It gets confused, can’t find its way around and drops the app more then it stays on it.  If it does it’s 4 day a week scheduled clean once a week I’m lucky.  I pretty much keep having to put it online only to have it drop off again.  I have strong WiFi and it’s close to the router. I’m completely fed up.  I also have a botvac d6 and it likes to drop the internet regularly too.  A lot of money spent for very little return.  Fed up.

title: Need better help & faqs
text: Vacuum works great..app works okay but could be much improved.  My biggest issue and one of the reasons why I selected the Neato D5  was because I thought it could do spot and manual cleaning through the app.  I’m on same WiFi SSID and 2.4ghz as the vacuum but on the Spot screen there are no options (completely blank) and there is NO Manual cleaning screen.  If the vacuum you have does support it then it should say somewhere, whether in the app or their website (which says it does) As far as I can tell, they should be available.

title: Only works 75% of the time
text:
When this app and the robot work it’s nothing short of impressive. Sadly free my first robot was returned under warranty the second one has the same issues.

The app often won’t connect to the robot, without the app which allows access to most of robots navigation and scheduling features this device simply isn’t worth the price.

Other issues with the hardware itself include the robot cannot clean carpet. It will ask you to clean it’s brush even when the brush is clean,& as often as about every 5 minutes. This result is on carpet that is only 3/8 in deep.

title: Won’t connect? Master Reset.
text: The robotvac is nice. The app itself is just ok. It could be so much better. The only major problem so far was that the app/bot wouldn’t connect to wifi initially. All of the bells and whistles I bought the D7 for are unusable without the app. After two weeks back and forth with support suggesting unneeded changes my router and password, I finally received directions for a Master Reset. It worked. I now have a connected D7. But the app is frustrating to use.

title: Stick with iRobot — App & WiFi range are horrible, no 5G support
text:
The D3 connected vacuum is ok, although it tends to get stuck a lot and often doesn’t clean the whole room. Additionally the WiFi adapter in the D3 DOES NOT SUPPORT 5ghz WIFI!!!

The app is complete garbage. I have reset and reconnected the vacuum to WiFi about a million times and 98% of the time it fails to find any WiFi networks even when sitting directly next to my router. When it does connect, it will fail to rename 9/10 times. If you can get it to rename, it will lose connection when it is only 20 feet from the router. 

If you can get the app to work (star’s aligned + blue moon), the app is poorly designed. There is no option to stop the running bot and return to base. The bots settings can’t be changed unless it is stopped and on the base. It’s a joke. I could write a better app in 3 days myself. 

Last Neeto product I will ever buy. Save your money and stick with iRobot.

title: Lousy connectivity. Clumsy vacuum.
text: This expensive purchase was supposed to be a game-changer and it was nothing but a disaster. I’m a cybersecurity professional and I was unable to get this lousy app to pair with my Botvac D7. Out of curiosity, I attempted to run the D7 without using the app to gauge its performance, noise, and navigation. While it was relatively gentle on my white baseboards and doors, it got hung up on the first chair it encountered. Worse, it sat in one spot spinning its wheels on the wooden flats of that same chair causing damage to the finish. I packed it up and I’m taking it back. No consumer should have to spend two hours dealing with connectivity issues at this price point. Huge waste of time and energy,

title: Either app or robot is faulty.
text: My D7 works great and vacuums well. However, I can’t get it to upload it’s current, or any previous floor plan. It does it’s thing around the house, returns to the base and the app says “new floor plan ready to upload”. Well, it tries and fails. So I can’t draw zones or no go lines. No option to “save” a floor plan. Emails, chats and texts have provided no fix. “Paul” has been sent back for warranty repair. Like I said, not sure if it’s the robot software or the app. If it comes back fixed, I’ll gladly change my review to 5 stars.

title: Decent robot, terrible support
text: The most recent bot update causes instant death to my D5. The robot will no longer clean or connect. I don’t recommend trying the update unless you are within the return period. I tried with 3 bots before I just decided to skip the update with my latest. I have called and emailed customer support. Phone support goes through a long list of steps and then pronounces the bot dead. Email support goes weeks between responses and does not provide a solution. I requested support in October. It is now February. Disappointing as the robot does a nice job of cleaning when it works.

title: App is terrible
text: I wish I could give zero stars, but I can’t. Unfortunately I have no luck with the app and robot. I have had the D7 for a short while and every time I start a cleaning via the app, I get an error of ‘wrong floor, robot can not clean because map is located on a different floor.’ Our house is only one level, so how is this possible? Base has never moved, and nothing is around the corner where the base has always been located. Customer service has been less than helpful. I am extremely frustrated and honestly at this point will no longer recommend this vacuum to anyone.

title: Cleans well, app is buggy and annoying
text: I love our Neato. It cleans really well with and without the app running, however the app leaves a lot to be desired. About a week ago the app alerted me that the bot needs a software update. It got caught in a loop and would not update the bot, I had to restart it (start from scratch, renaming it, wiping any memory of our apt layout) to get the bot to clean again. Then, today, the app locks me out unless I update the app. The problem? No app update available in the app store. Great. Running my Neato manually... again.

title: App doesn’t work
text:
You get to the “name your vacuum” screen after jumping through several hoops connecting the thing to wifi and setting up accounts and verifying accounts and it just freezes and keeps loading and never lets you go forward to complete installation. I am trying to do this for my mother and this machine is proving to cause a lot problems.

The app itself also keeps booting off the wifi, which none of the other devices are having such problems. It should not be this hard to even get ON the app. I haven’t even been able to use the app itself yet before it stopped worked.

title: Botvac Connected
text: I like the concept, but support seems lacking all models after their initial release.  For example the Botvac Connected, although wifi enabled, lacks the no-go virtual lines that are enabled in subsequent models. They use the same navigation system, the same app but the firmware released for the Connected is lacking the features.  It seems that high dollar models should get the same software updates if and when they are capable to do so like the one I mentioned above without making the consumer purchase a new model almost yearly in order to so.....  🤔

title: Worthless
text: Comparing to my Roborock S 4 MAX this app and for that matter the thin useless QUICK START booklet leave you in the dark. The first two time it went out to clean it got itself hung up under two different small tables and kept repeating its motions like it didn’t want to go out the way it got in! Also unlike Roborock it didn’t save any maps.. I’ll try once more and then it’s being returned to Amazon...had to reposition on dock 5 times to get it to charge today...I want to like it but why does NEATO make it so damned difficult?? It did pick up a lot of dirt on its last run! Very frustrated!

title: Was working before last update — Frustrating
text: This app worked pretty well for me until the last update. Now it says App Update Required, yet there is no update available. I tried deleting and reinstalling, but that didn’t help either. Beyond frustrating that a $700 robotic vacuum is rendered useless because they can’t fix an app that’s had this problem for over 2 months. Tried to talk to customer service and they told me to allow location services, well guess what, that’s not in the app’s permissions nor in location services in settings. Ridiculous.

title: Better than worried
text: I was little bit worried due to too many bad reviews here but it turns pretty good. I suspect most of issues resulted from poor wifi connectivity. Only complaint I have is why I cannot assign the names to each rooms so that I may just ask to clean the room. Considering the capability already built in, I hope Neato will make it be available in next upgrade.

title: Extremely poor Wi-Fi set up
text: Getting the Wi-Fi set up it’s like corralling cats during a storm. I’ve reset this so many times,  I tried 4 different known good routers. I had to hard shut down every connected device within my network first just to connect to the bot. Go to the farthest end of my home from neighbors broadcasting SSID. Setup a hotspot from my phone in a particular location with the same name of my home network SSID & PW. It connected and registered to Neato servers.  Turned my hotspot off and turned my homework back up.  It’s offline.  Maybe if I rub some essential oils and incense....

title: Terrible!!!!
text: This app and robot need your WiFi router in the room with them because they ARE NEVER CONNECTED!!!! I have yet to see the map it made of my floors because she’s always offline and even when reconnected it only lasts minutes. I have a WiFi extender for my ring in the room with the base and that doesn’t work at all to help it. It constantly cleans the same room at least4 times, my guess is because it’s not online to draw a map. Battery dies during cleaning because of all the repeating so I’m not even sure it’s ever finished the downstairs. For the money it should be able to pick up WiFi that is only in the room above it!!

title: Challenging  App. Good vac
text:
Purchased D4 version. Unable to consistently connect to Wi-Fi. Thought defect with product. Returned product for same model. Still unable to connect to Wi-Fi. Multiple other products in house easily connect to Wi-Fi. Strong signal throughout entire vacuum area. Called customer service. Initially unable to connect product.

After I reset my router and cable modem, was able to easily connect device. Works wonderfully. Thank you for assistance!

title: Where are the Maps?
text:
I just moved and started using my D5 again, but it is not creating maps on the app anymore?!? I had successfully used the app at my previous home both up and down stairs. Is that the problem, it does not want to do a third floor plan? If so, how do I delete the old ones?

Also, before we moved, I had the filter drying (after cleaning) and we accidentally turned it on and it blew all of the debris into the motherboard area... shouldn’t the machine have warned us that it was missing a piece?

title: Can’t send to base or pause
text: I used to be able to pause and send the vac back to base while it was running using the app. For some reason, I can no longer do that. Once I click start, I have to just let it finish running its course because my only option is to click “start” again (it does not toggle to pause). I’m not sure why this feature was removed, but please add it back. It’s frustrating not being able to cancel it once it starts running.

title: Remote app update
text:
I like being able to operate the robot from an app. However, there are two things that stand out to me so far. 

1.) the docking button is greyed out so I can’t tell it to dock when I want to cut its cleaning short for multiple reasons. 
2.) When the brush becomes obstructed. I can’t just turn it off till I get home to clear the obstruction 

Please let me know if there is a way I can gain access to those two options.

Update: I Received a reply to the above the questions. The first one it was stated that if I wait for 10 minute run time then pause it the docking button does become available and it does.  But not after that point I couldn’t get it to become functional. I believe it should be available at any point during the cleaning process. 

The second question was answered to my satisfaction.

We originally had a Samsung 9350 loved the suction loved the mapping and control but hated the fact it would not return to the base regularly so returned it.  We waited and waited for the D7 release but never got a confirmed release date so we settled for the connected bot. We love it but wish we could have waited for the D7 as the no go lines would help with our home size.  Any future plans on putting the no go lines on the connected bot? Or better yet can we upgrade to the D7 since we’ve only had this one 5 months?

title: Terrible
text: Based on the reviews I read from d7 on many different forums and my own experience, the software and firmware developed by Neato borders on incompetent. I don’t know how many people need to complain, and for how many years, but the issue about maps not matching the surrounding has gone on long enough. Reduce the sensitivity of the startup scan, or allow the user to say continue without the map - do something! I don’t think my D7 has ever gone more than a week without requiring me to redo the maps and usually, it doesn’t work and I run it without.

title: Frustrating. Bot firmware or app needs update
text: Our bot continually disconnects from the stored floor plan, forcing yet another exploratory run. Users on Reddit and various forums experience the same issue so it’s clear my experience is not unique. For the first month the bot performed well but the last two months have been frustrating to say the least. Map storage shouldn’t be an issue and at this stage in the application’s development a patch should have been issued. If support can not resolve this issue we’ll be moving to another platform and ask for a full refund on the hardware.

title: Great app, Great sweeper
text: I just purchased my first Neato D5. Before I had a robot that would be all over missing spots. With the app and the product I have a whole floor clean. The app was a little frustrating to set up, but after the reward was worth it. The no go lines in the app are a must have. Thanks to Neato I have a great product and a new clean floor. I hope more will see and choose these great products.

title: Is WiFi connectivity rocket science??
text: Neato updated the app which made my 2019 d6 robot obsolete. Now it won’t connect to any WiFi networks. Even before this event,  connecting this paperweight to WiFi networks was a chore. It’s 2020, how is it this difficult. I could get a PlayStation 2 to connect to WiFi faster than this app even opens. Even still the sensors are a lazy and idiotic design. For their premium price, it still just bumps into random things even it has a laser range finder on top. Then once it gets stuck, this app also crashes. Lol. I hope Neato goes bankrupt.

title: Very good product!
text:
My new D7 has impressed the hell out of me!  I know it’s not perfect but when you get this setup correctly it works fantastic.  
It’s amazing how much this thing picks up, by getting places you normally don’t or can’t get to.

Note to the Developers:

What would be really nice is....

A “quiet” house survey for creating or resetting your floor plan.

To be quiet when traveling to a designated zone for cleaning.

The ability to select multiple zones to clean at once.

The ability to designate sub-zones  within zones that could indicate high traffic areas for more cleaning passes.

The ability to have multiple “no-go” line  map configurations.

The ability to draw poly line zones.

A “spiral” spot clean mode.

👍🏻

title: Very frustrating
text: When I first purchased the D3 I was able to connect to my Wi-Fi and had no issues then about a year went by and it is constantly off-line.  I cannot get it reconnected after several attempts so I’m going to actually get rid of this vacuum. With the time I spend trying to get it reconnected I could have pulled out my vacuum cleaner and cleaned my whole house.  Very disappointed in this product. I Purchased it so it makes my life easier.

title: Good app but could improve
text: I like this app it works well for me and basically I have no big complaint.  But, an improvement that you could add is a way to find your machine.  There are times when it gets stuck or “lost “and I have to go looking for it .  Would be nice if it had a tracker on a map or a beeper to find it if it is under furniture somewhere.

title: Fix the app
text: For the past 2+weeks, my phone has been unable to connect to my robot.  I can use Alexa to start it or push the button to start it but my phone just says “robot connecting....” I am unable to schedule cleanings and it doesn’t recognize the cleanings that have been scheduled for over a year.  It also randomly stops or returns to just in front of the base but will not dock.  Leaving it dead in the morning-usually after not completing a cleaning.  I’m assuming it has something to do with the recent Apple update-but if so, the app needs to be updated so it functions.

title: App is Great
text:
The app is easy to use, it’s intuitive, it supports multiple robots and it offers a floor plan map of where it has cleaned. 

My wish list items would be to see where the robot is in real time and to be able to select ‘resume cleaning’ remotely for those times the robot decides to stop because it thinks the roller needs to be cleaned in mid cycle.

title: Please do not purchase a Neato
text: The application pairs perfectly well with my D5. Please do not take this as a positive. The app works so so, when functioning properly. That goes to say that the D5 works so so, when functioning. The application has had bugs despite multiple updates. It doesn’t pair well with the D5 vacuum. The no-go line feature works best if you’ve made many lines in the area you don’t want the vacuum to go. The app/vacuum is inconsistent with floor plans you have created. I was drawn by the design of the vacuum, but now regret not getting a competitor’s robo-vacuum.

title: Terrible
text:
The app won’t connect to the robot. It takes the WiFi password, then it prompts to name the robot. Then I hit ‘next’ and nothing happens. App crashes. Tried multiple times and it’s just absolutely not working.

I have tried their support chat on their website, spoke to Luke who kicked me out of chat right after sending me some useless link to download another app (which didn’t help at all either). Going to return this vac, please don’t waste your money on this. You won’t get any help from their customer service whatsoever

title: Needs a lot of work, this app.
text: A very cool device.  The robot, not the app or the UX.   It is extremely difficult to create a useable floor plan, so far.  The device loses it’s charge before it finishes a map.  The map it creates is serviceable but the app won’t let me save and use it because the robot thinks it’s is incomplete.  Bad UX. BAD experience. I’ve had it one week and I’m considering returning it because of the interface.  If you are satisfied placing it in room and letting it go, then manually returning it to the charger, you’ll be satisfied.  It’s very frustrating because it is so close to being cool and useable.   What a bummer.

title: Terrible.
text: Buy a different vacuum. Part of the appeal of a robo vacuum is the app. This app is by far the worst experience. After 2 hours on the chat with Neato, they wanted me to change settings on my WiFi so that it would work. Any other technology works just fine with WiFi without such drastic changes and hoops to jump through. After a month of never even getting my app connected, I returned this price of junk and got a roomba- definitely easy app! Get a roomba. Same price ($500) and works way better!!! No hassle!

title: After updating D7 has issues connecting
text:
Update: 

Day 2:

Received new firmware for my D7 this morning.  Setup zones and ran a cleaning for one.  The vacuum left the base the stopped and paused.   Then when trying to run another cleaning job from the app nothing happened.  The app shows it is being tapped on to clean but nothing happens.   After several attempts I got one cleaning to work.   I also setup schedule zone cleaning.   The schedule did not work.  

It seams this update was not properly tested.  It’s a shame since I felt Neato was a software company and would have better quality controls to prevent such a poor rollout. 

Day 1:

Great they added zone cleaning; however, after downloading the app the D7 has issues connecting.   Had no issue with the prior version.  

The D7 hasn’t received the firmware update enabling zones, so that might be the issue. Also I am connecting from the app outside my network.

title: Neato 5 Stars!
text:
People are so nit picky ...  it works very well , it comes w boundary strips to keep it from going places u don’t want it to.   Does a very thorough job .   It does need to be clean always ... some people have poor internet and most people are lazy ... I’m sure most peoples houses are filthy also .  
They need a cleaning company first . 
this does a great job.  Negative is It won’t take out the garbage .

title: Saves my time for more important things
text: I’d rather spend my time with family or friends, and that’s what the Neato does! The vacuum and app are great together. The only issue I’ve had is creating a floor plan. Every time I try, the vacuum will no longer work until I reset the floor plan. (But I won’t fault the app for that!) even without that feature, I love my Neato!

title: Love my Neato (3rd one owned)
text: Love love love my Neato. I have had 3 and they are wonderful. My biggest issue is the fact that you cannot chose the extra care option permanently. Without it, it always has issues getting stuck trying to clean around guitar stands. When I use extra care it works beautifully. Please add the option to make this a default and not something I have to select every time

title: Almost great
text:
I’ve also had issues with my robot going offline until I created an IP reservation for it on my router. It’s been almost two months since its gone offline. Keeping my fingers crossed.

I like the new map feature, but the share button is right in the middle of the map, not in the bottom corner shown in the screen shots. What’s up with that?  It’s annoying!

Almost a great app.

title: Great vacuum, bad app with connection issues.
text: I loved this vacuum the first few weeks I had it and then like so many other people have said, the connection issues started happening. I did everything the online help says to no avail. I haven’t changed anything with my router. It just doesn’t work. It is so disappointing. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend buying a D7 Neato. For 700 bucks, it should be able to connect to my network.

title: Not At All User Friendly
text: This app claims wonderful features, very few of which actually work on a regular basis. Much of this may be due to the vacuum rather than the app. For a vacuum at the top of the price point, the functionality has been completely disappointing to say the least. Vacuum often becomes disconnected, is not operable from the app, cannot map a floor plan as shown...just gives error messages constantly. Do yourself a favor and shop around options before jumping on this brand.

title: Asinine
text:
This app is atrocious. I am highly technically savvy, and I can’t set up my D7 vac. This app simply doesn’t work, it keeps freezing and simply refuses to connect. The developers haven’t updated the app in 10 months despite other terrible reviews and issues posted. I’ll repeat that again...10 MONTHS! 

Avoid this product and company. They have already proven to abandon their own creation with no regard for their customers. If you’re going to charge hundreds for a product, I expect the thing to work properly. Absolutely pathetic.

title: Not a fan.
text: I am very disappointed w the vacuum. It is always unconnected even though it was connected initially according to directions I got on the phone from you. I try several things haphazardly until It finally works for less than an hour. Back to charging and the same routine again. Because of the pandemic I cannot get phone help now. I do not get any clear instructions from your page either. Why don’t you include a paper brochure that we could consult??? Very unhappy w the Neato. I’ll never recommend it.

title: Doesn’t work - update to it works!
text:
I was excited with the update feature supposedly allowing users to set no-cross lines as opposed to having to physically block any areas the bot should not go to. I keep trying to make the initial run to then be able to mark the off-limits but it just doesn’t work. Please fix

Update. The support department helped me resolve the issue, thanks so much for support and follow up!

title: I want to love it
text: I thought I wrote a review before but I guess not. I have had all sorts of trouble getting the thing the connect and you cannot unschedule it if you cannot connect to it. I ended up having to unscrew everything, clean everything, blow everything off, and then unplug the battery and replug it and start all over to get it to work again. When it rebooted, it needed an update and then it connected pretty easily. We will see how it goes now..

title: the floor map after the upgrade is back!
text:
With this new app upgrade, the floor map disappeared during cleaning!  But you can see it after the cleaning is done.  Not as good as before to see the dynamic map as the neato is going through the cleaning, which is cool. 

Neato, thank you for at least keeping the floor map!

title: Great app!
text: Mostly always works great for me, but sometimes needs to be restarted to connect. I love the no-go lines feature - If only you could save certain maps with no-go lines as presets that you could rename for each room of the house. That way you could just select the room and Botvac would navigate to it.

title: Bad app!!
text: We have had our expensive D7 for 6months and have had nothing but problem with it.   After a few months we had issues, called customer service , who by the way was very rude to us trying to place the problem on us, and ended up after a lot of paperwork getting another roller bar.  Not the problem.  We continue to have a lot of app issues.  Very poor service!  Think I’ll go to the original roomba!

title: Won’t add robot
text: It’s a disappointment. After the robot no longer being connected, I decided to add it again. Following all the instructions won’t help, the App has a bug when you name your robot: loading screen for a split second and then nothing, back to the naming screen without possibility to complete the process. Would have assumed that this new version would have leveraged non-regression tests but it doesn’t seem to be the case... now I’m stuck with a robot that won’t even connect, my luck.

title: Life Changing
text: I have had the Neato D-3 Connected 8 months. Besides when I twice had to set it up again with my network, I have absolutely no complaints about the vacuum or the software. The No-Go lines are sheer genius. I have my vacuum set to run at 3:30 PM every day. The app notifies me if the vacuum get stuck or when it’s done cleaning for the day. Simple and amazing.

title: Excellent product. Decent app
text:
App needs a lot of work that would be highly appreciated but isn’t as bad as other reviewers say it is. 
It takes some time to map out your house for the first time but after that it makes cleaning easier. 

Edit: Neato D3 does not have manual option in the first place. Thanks for comment, devs.

title: A few improvements but can do better
text: I love Neato. It just does so much when you’re not home! With the newest update you can draw no-go lines to avoid neato enter areas you don’t want it to go. This is a great feature though but, would be great to tell neato to go to a specific spot as well. Would be great to see another update where you can select an area you want neato to go clean and return to base. This would help so much and I’ll be forever happy.

title: Do you even test your products?
text: Both app and the hardware features are badly constructed. Ideas and suction power are great, but the execution is terrible. Not to mention that to access any of the features one must create an account. So no functionality I pay for unless I give you my private information? Very user-friendly. The device keeps disconnecting and I have to hard reset and re-add it almost every day. Really? Don’t you have product managers to ensure quality? Appalling, to say the least.

title: Horrible app
text: App is horrible. First off when the vacuum runs in the schedule there is no way to stop it. I have to rerun the floor plan every 3 months. Then randomly the vacuum won’t recognize the floor plan. I’ve reached out to support multiple times and all I get is the same reset the app, rerun the floor plan, etc. For the amount I spent on this I would like to see them offer a replacement on the vacuum or update the app. For the price of this I’m very dissatisfied with it.

title: Awful concept
text: The fact you all move to an OS that is dependent on Wifi connection and a smart phone to read the error message is redivision’s. I’m not sure how that was passed and though of as a good idea. Always have system that can be ran independently, you know like the older models. This model has given me nothing but issues alway needed to be reconnected, reset and never know what the issue is until i open my phone and reconnect everything. This is my 4 th Neato and sad to see this. If i continue to have issues i’ll just be returning it and switching brands.

title: notifications stopped but customer service helped
text:
Customer service helped fix my particular issue and the problem outlined below is no more. Great job! 

Prior issue:
Literally did not change ANYTHING on my phone (no update, no settings whatsoever) and it just stopped sending me notifications to my iphone 6s.

title: Not even a year old and can’t connect to WiFi anymore
text: I got my Neato May of 2018 and absolutely love it!!! Until last week when all of the sudden it will no longer connect to my WiFi. I have used this vacuum just about everyday and out of no where with no changes made it will no longer connect to my WiFi. Extremely upset since they are not cheap and not even a year old. I talked very highly of this vacuum and recommended it to everyone but not anymore.

title: Kinda Clunky to Set Up
text: A bit could be done on the app to make initial setup smoother, but I’m sooo happy it learns to clean in rows vs. random. Super happy with the battery life and cleaning out the gate. I’m still giving this 5-Stars because once I got a quick assist fro customer support (a native speaker) I was on my way to cleaning bliss.

title: Loving my new Neato D7
text: So far the app has been working great. I found the zones very easy to setup. Our family just got a golden retriever puppy and running my Neato a few times per day has helped keep up with all the fluff. I just ordered a 2nd charging station so I could run and map our 2nd level :)

title: More than amazed
text: We had relatively low expectations for a robot vacuum but thought that any help keeping up with our three cats would be good. Boy, were we surprised! The D7 does an almost unbelievable job of keeping the carpet clean. We have it set to clean every day. The carpets have never looked so good. Usual disclaimers: no affiliation with Neato etc. , just a satisfied owner.

title: Lacking development for D5 model
text: The vacuum works well, however the latest features available in the iOS Neato app only support the D7 Neato.  Only the D7 supports “virtual no go lines” per the latest Neato iOS app release note.  I guess paying hundreds of dollars for one of Neato’s robots only pays off if you buy the newest and highest dollar one, as they don’t apply new developments to the ones which are only one version old.  Not the way to create repeat business Neato.

title: Great update
text:
With the latest update,  the WIFI stays connected and seeing a map of what has been cleaned is great.  Great job Neato

Update Feb 4, 2018.
It’s been a few weeks since the latest update and have had no issues with WIFI connections since. My D3 Botvac stays connected and even reconnected to my router automatically after a power outage.

title: Original Neato App is Straight Garbage
text: This app is straight crap. Always reconnecting my robot to wifi at LEAST once a month. Upgraded my home wifi, same issues. Neato barely maintains this app and its very buggy. The process of reconnecting a robot is a pain, and takes several tries!  Instead of fixing the app Neato has decided to make a new app for their new robots only. This is NOT a fix for all of the people that regularly have issues with existing robots. Dirty company, this will be my first and last Neato product.

title: Needs drive mode
text: I really enjoy the app, and the no go lines were a big selling point for me. I think the next addition should have “drive mode” where you could drive the robot to certain areas for quick cleanup spills and things.

title: Thankfully had a better experience than this app’s average rating
text: To preface, I have an older phone (iPhone SE) and not ideal WiFi. The app still works fairly well for me and not had frustrating issues with it since I bought the vacuum 3 months ago. Very glad!

title: Works well overall, but slightly buggy
text:
We had a bit of trouble setting the botvac up initially, but once everything was set, it was automated and smooth. 

We had to move the robot base closer to our router and that fixed the bugginess issues we experienced.

The update that allowed room designation and specific area cleaning was amazing, works perfectly.

title: Forever offline
text: The vacuum itself is fine but the connectivity is a nightmare. It just doesn't work. I was briefly able to get this online and working with the app for a few days. That's it. Every now and then I try again. I deleted the app from my phone a few days ago with the intent of reinstalling and pairing the vac again. Apparently that's never going to happen. I can even get the app to download again. Sigh. This would be a cool product if it worked as advertised. 🤷🏾‍♀️

title: Lack of functionalities
text: This is a constructive critique although the robot is excellent the app lacks of information and supporting functionalities. For example: Today I  placed the robot to clean the whole house, the way it usually does, but it only cleansed certain areas and left 2/3 of the house without cleaning. You should have a way to restarting the house map so it will go to all areas. And that is only an example of functionalities It should have.

title: 2 year old paperweight
text: I’ve had this unit for two years now and I still have to reach bend over and press the on button for it to start and stop the web app does not work it is not highly connected it is never connected and it has not done anything it says it supposed to do unable to get it to do it and I am an IT professional this would make a great remote control toy.  That is about all it is good for but the app doesn’t work so you can’t even use it for that.

title: The app works better than the vacuum!
text: I’m so sick and tired of getting the “floor plan navigation” error! Out of its 5 day schedule, I might get 2 days of cleaning. After multiple resets it might clean again. Customer support was thorough, but informed me later the unit was not in warrantee.  I just would feel so much better putting it in the driveway and running it over with my truck!

title: Neato app not neat at all
text: First off, I will say when the app works with the vacuum it is amazing. However, In the recent update I have been given errors that it could not read my floor plan. I reached out to support and they have yet been able to fix my issue. I even went out of my way to get a new one and still the issue persists..this is Neato’s downfall (not being able to fix the app bugs). If they can focus on making this work, they would be the best in the business!

title: New version of app/firmware breaks the robot
text: Everything worked flawlessly until this app update and firmware update. When I run the program, the start button doesn’t change to pause or stop. The robot just leaves it’s base about a foot and stops and beeps. I have to hit the “I” button a couple of times to get it to run. If it does run, it ends up missing 2 rooms on the other end of the house. Sometimes it just spins in circles while navigating a hallway. The robot is almost unusable and very unreliable. Please update and fix this bugs.

title: Perfect but...
text:
The app is perfect we cannot download it from our local AppStore in Turkey. We also want to see the app in Turkish AppStore. 

Also there is a bug with the robot. Robot turns back to its base to charge and to continue cleaning. But my battery charges only up to %84 (after 270 charge cycles) and The robot needs at least %85 to continue cleaning. So it does not restart cleaning. This is a bug and makes the robot useless even after 270 charge cycles. Hope anyone read this comment and reply to me.

title: Love Neato, but reconnecting to WiFi seems touch?
text: When I have to reboot and reconnect to WiFi the process never works or me the first time...multiple tries required. I’m not stupid, I have a great internet connection. Please guys, have mercy and improve this. Update: The developer has contacted me to help to see what I might be doing incorrectly.  Thank you for the customer service.  I’ll update on my findings!

title: Tired of having to redo floor plans
text: First of all the vacuum itself is great. Picks up my dog’s long hair just as I’d hoped. HOWEVER, the app is  regularly unable to see my floor plan even when I’m looking right at it on the app. I’ve had it about 1-1/2 months and haven’t had a full week where it runs as promised. I’ve had to redo the floor plan at least 5 times. It loses contact with the wi-fi for no discernible reason and then has to be paired again. FRUSTRATING to be promised features that don’t consistently work.

title: Happy as a clam with my Botvac Connected
text: We’ve had our unit for 2 1/2 years and can’t say enough good things about it. The cleaning capability is better than we had hoped for. The app is easy to use. We’ve had to reconnect to Wi-Fi every 4-6 months, but that’s easy to do. Now if it would only clean behind open doors!

title: The app was great at first
text: At first when you bring your robot home to use and you’re excited to set it up and try it out, the app works wonderfully. You can setup scheduled cleaning days and times. It allows you select gentle cleaning or turbo. The vacuum it’s self is great! Didn’t even fall down the stairs! However, the app doesn’t stay connected to the vacuum. I have to constantly uninstall it and setup my vacuum over and over. It’ll just keep telling me it’s connecting but never does.

title: App is junk
text:
I have 2 D7 robots. One stopped connecting to WiFi. I reset the WiFi multiple times and every time I connect to my network, I got an error saying there is no internet. 

I deleted the robot and deleted the app since I hadn’t done so since I upgraded to ios15. Reinstalled the app but now Location Services is no longer and option. Why is this a big deal? Apparently you cannot re-setup a robot without Location Services and there is no option to turn it on.

title: Great Vac but Broken App
text:
We spent a lot of money on our D7 and loved it for about 1 year. Now it won’t maintain a connection to the app. You can trouble shoot and fight with the hardware and software to reconnect, but the issue persists. One day it will connect and the next it will not with no rhyme or reason.  Do not buy these products, how has the app RECEIVED NO UPDATES FOR OVER A YEAR??? 

Tech support keeps giving us the same canned response. We want our product to work as advertised. Your hot fixes are unacceptable.

title: Most annoying device we own
text: Our D3 is two years old now.. we have never had a great experience with the connection from the robot to our app. It regularly needs to reset the cleaning map and it takes hours/days to reconnect the device to the WIFI. I would not recommend anyone waste their time or money. Would get a 3 star if it at least had a manual operating option. But it will not run with out being connect to wifi

title: Vacuum is good. App needs work
text: Do not want to hate on my little d4 connected. It’s good.    But the app is the opposite of user friendly.   Setting up “no go” lines it’s honestly awful.  I can’t imagine it being more tedious and difficult to use.       That’s the main function of the app.       Please make this easier to use.       Could add shapes with adjustable sizes and many other functions to improve the functionally and user experience.

title: So far everything is great
text: I’ve recently seen a lot of negative reviews with the new update for the app. So far, I had no issues whatsoever. The only thing I would love is if the vacuum would automatically go back to its dock if a path to a zone is blocked. Besides that, I never had an issue with the app or my vacuum.

title: Love the machine - hate the app
text: The Neato WiFi network requires I LOWER my router access settings. Every time I try to connect it takes hours and this time I have just given up. It’s like neato isn’t keeping up with new protocols and is stuck back three years. So frustrating. I recommend the machine but just don’t count on it working with the app. I can’t update the firmware without the connection. I have had three Neato bots but this will be my last. Switching to another brand when this one dies.

title: Buggy. Difficult to navigate.
text:
The bot vacs themselves are an amazing and intelligent design. Apparently Neato didn’t feel the need to extend this to their app. 

I have had countless problems adding robots (I have now owned 3, two different models). For instance, the button will stay greyed-out while trying to connect. 

The UX is also the opposite of intuitive. Some things are very neat, and it looks good, but it’s hard to find what you are looking for.

title: Great job!
text:
D6 model
Easy wifi set up! Easy scheduling on the app. Not as loud as I've seen complained about; quieter than my Shark Pro upright and a whole lot lighter!! More frequent bin changes at the beginning but got less frequent over time! Gets my area rugs pretty clean! I live in the woods and have 6 dogs.... hair and fir needles everywhere, but the Neato gets them just fine!

title: Fix the problem already
text:
I have been using my neato for 4 years. I never had a problem with it connecting to my phone.  .  .
Suddenly it is the same as everyone else who left a review. The customer support are useless. Maybe if you would admit there is a problem you could save people a lot of aggravation. I wish I read more reviews before I bought it. It looks like I will need a new one and it certainly won’t be a neato. Thanks for nothing.

title: This App is horrible
text: I ordered this vac based on reviews online but I just received the Neato D7 and this app is the worst! I’ve been trying to connect my Wifi to to machine for over an hour and it just will not connect therefore, I’m not able to use the Neato like I should be able to. I will have to return this item and I’m very disappointed especially since I paid over $400 for this product I should have this problem. I do not recommend buying the Neato!!!!

title: Great vac, abysmal app
text: Vac works as it should. But why can you not use all the features with scheduled cleanings? The extra care navigation works great and you should be able to use it with your schedules cleanings. No reason that I can think of to not allow the two to work together. Now my robot will slam itself so hard into the coffee table it gets itself stuck. All your models are pretty pricey and locking functionality out is not the best way to keep customers.

title: Started great but going downhill
text: We bought our botvac about a year ago and it was fantastic. We clean it regularly and change out the filters and brush regularly. Recently it just seems to not find its way home no matter what we do. It cleans incompletely and gets lost. I was hoping it just needed an update but everything seems up to date. ☹️

title: Does not manually drive with iphone 11 on Botvac Connected
text:
Everything works except manual steering mode. I have to use an iphone 6 to manually steer. Can you guys update your software to add this feature to current iphones?  

Also, please give us zone control. Perhaps allow us to use the map to name each room. Then we could tell Siri to clean a room. Thanks.

title: Inconsistent app
text:
The app worked for a few months. It disconnected from the botvac twice. But was able to reconnect. 
Now, it’s disconnected again. But it won’t reconnect this time. The app keeps looping at the “name your robot” screen. 
I’ve done all the things the help desk has asked me to do with no positive results. 
I hope they fix this app someday. 
If I had know how poor the app and help would be, I would’ve bought the competitor.

title: Can't keep it from going offline
text: I bought this for Christmas 2017 installed it with the help of neato support.  But it goes offline everyday.  I can run it manually but trying to use google to start and stop.  I have tried at least five tries it ran successfully (vacuum the house and re docked it self.) only once the other times I did it manually. I am getting frustrated.  My wifi is with xfinity.  I have Botvac D5.

title: App is a severe detriment to great hardware
text: My robot functions great once the app stops  “glitching” out. Often I have to close the app and restart 1-2x prior to the robot leaving its base to begin a cleaning. Also no go lines and other features must be used from the app. So home assistant functionality is practically useless. I think neato should consider giving this app a major overhaul so the robots great hardware isn’t hindered by the shortcomings in software.

title: This thing is garbage.
text: I’ve had the Botvac D6 Connected for about 2 years. When it works, it works well. But through the app, that’s almost never. I’ve gotten lucky and had it work for a couple of months a few times, but it usually doesn’t. Now, I haven’t been able to use it through the app in about 5 months. It simply won’t connect to WiFi anymore. I’ve tried deleting and reloading the app, reconnecting, “hard” shut-downs... nothing works.

title: Returning tomorrow
text: Been working with this product for 15 days, and it is such a hassle.  The floor mapping is horrible and it does not actually perform “manual/follow” mode through the app.   If you have a WiFi extender, it does not recognize it as the same network.  I’ve never had this issue with other robot vacuums. It also gets stuck extremely easy.  I don’t understand how this company thinks that this product can even be sold at half the price of a Roomba.

title: Our New Best Friend
text:
D7 is a robot vacuum that has set the new standard by which all other manufacture will need to follow if they wish to survive in this market of robotics. 
Virtual lines are awesome.  We will install a virtual line if we only need part of the house cleaned or have an area that must be temporarily avoided. 
I can’t say enough about the D7 robot!

title: All preparation No H
text: We've had Roomba robotic vacs for probably 10 years, but were excited to try the Neato, as the Roomba always seems to get "stupid" after about 2 1/2 years. Read good reviews so decided to try it. First, suction seems ok, and did like the non-randomness of the pattern; however, it didn't do the edges as well as the Roomba,  was way slower, got tangled up in the fringe of the area rugs, had to tape down the border marker onto the floor, and then ultimately didn't get the floor nearly as clean. Lots of fern leaves left. Not so Neato... Took it back and bought another Roomba.

title: Buy a different vacuum from a different manufacturer
text: The  neato consistently disconnects from WiFi. The vacuum has already been replaced once by the manufacturer and now I’m about to have my second replace. This is a $600 vacuum. This is unacceptable. With all the issues I have had I requested to change it out for a different model so this pain would stop. They said sorry we can keep replacing it but they can not change model. Choose a different vacuum and app by a different manufacturer. Don’t give this company your hard earned money.

title: Not compatible with iOS 13
text: After a period of working my iPhone is unable to connect with the vacuum.  During the pairing process the  vacuum cannot connect with the Neato Servers. After working with phone support the vacuum was sent it into Neato for evaluation. After being returned the same issue persisted. Neato claims that their app is not compatible with iOS 13 (released Sept 19) and to try with a device using iOS 12. This is not an option. The vacuum is useless until this app is updated.

title: Needs work
text: It does a good job of cleaning but— goes off line often. Why.? Doesn’t usually clean all the rooms. Does sometimes. Has had a hard time learning where to go next. Sometimes it does half a room then goes on to the next. I kind of figure “it will get it next time”.  I really wonder if it works this way because it is the least expensive model. Can someone tell me?

title: Bad app
text: Presently we have had this D5 robot about a month.  For some reason the robot started not running, or would run for shorter and shorter times.  Until it would not run.  We looked at the book because it disconnected from the app.  We tried rebooting the app.  Not nothing connects and the robot just sit there.  If there is anything that I am missing please inform me to get the recently purchased robot to work.  We had a previous Neato robot for years.  This one seems to be buggie.  I hope Neato monitors this review.  I need help.

title: App is good. Robot is better.
text: I love the performance of the robot. The app could use some work, but overall gets the job done well with minor hiccups. If there was one thing I would request, it would be a mode for medium to high pile rugs that the robot could go over a few times instead of a single run to clean deeper. Small thing but it means a lot. Loving Neato.

title: Lousy software/app
text:
Always disconnecting and reconnecting is a hassle and very buggy!
The vacuum itself is good but when I replace it I’ll replace with a brand that has enough sense to know that the appliance is worthless without good software to run the darn thing!
I’m not to lazy to sweep my floors. I just prefer not to have to spend hours doing it. I STILL have to spend hours because it takes that long every other time or so to reconnect the device to WiFi. 
Fix it already!!

title: BAD INVESTMENT
text:
I got this all futuristic brand new Vacum and for three whole days we try to connected to the wifi with out success 
Basically every family member went over and over the same instructions and rituals and just can’t make it work. We have strong wifi, close to this worthless pice of expensive NAETO
Can’t believe $500 straight to the trash 
I’m advising people to look for and research before making companies rich on worthless products like this

title: Map no longer showing
text: Reviewing the app. I got the Botvac Connected and my maps are not showing up anymore. Last map was generated on Jun-28. I tried delete the app and reinstalling but still not working. Got in touch with the support chat but not solved the problem (robot no longer broadcasting wifi to connect within app). I wish there was an option to configure the app using the robot seriam number without needing to connect to its wifi

title: Terrible
text: The vacuum is so good but the software so bad that it never works. There is always a new problem:  plans not loading (even if there are no plans set); the vacuum doesn’t do anything even if there is a schedule; sometimes it gets stuck with no-go lines but the standard cleaning without them works without problems. Everything is random, if the vacuum cleans, you are lucky! If the app works, you have evidenced a miracle. Please fix the software, it is a pity, the vacuum is great but only when it works.

title: Needs more actual functionality
text:
This app is all flash and very little function

This app should at the very least have the same features as the menu on the robot. 

Would like to schedule high traffic areas more frequently than other rooms

Would like to define rooms and clean in a specific order

Would like the app to be able to start cleaning just one specific room from the charger then return 

All features should be accessible remotely 

The app and robot should be secure Apple Homekit compliant

All features on the app should be fully voiceover (iOS) compliant

The controls on the robot should be fully accessible to Blind people

Releasing an app update that is all about only the flash with little to no added function is less than encouraging about the future of your business

title: Product is garbage!!
text: I got the neato connected D3It worked a few times and now it will not connect to your very own app. The vacuum is a paperweight.I have talked with support several times and they’re asking me to open up ports that everyone on the Internet says do not ever open or you will be hacked! What exactly is going on with these vacuum cleaners that don’t work whatsoever? Then they told me to way to hotspot.  Excuse me?!  Why doesn’t your product work with your own app???????

title: Request
text: Love the app and product, but it would be helpful to see the cleaning status of the robot in future updates. For instance while the vacuum is charging, show the areas it still has left to clean.

title: Botvac connected
text:
Update:after writing this review I received a message from the team and the maps started working. Amazing! Very happy with the purchase.

Bought the botvac connected after paying premium price, but I could never see the coverage maps. No way I can set eco option to default. The app is very limited.

title: Great vacuum so so app
text: The app does the basics but it is lacking.
