The app is missing the ability to pick more than one room/zone which is a major inconvenience if you have two rooms you would like to clean at the same time.  The device doesn’t have a bin full sensor so instead it randomly alerts you based on time to empty the bin.

title: Junk app
text: The vacuum is very nice but the app is absolutely horrible. I spent hundreds of dollars on it (D7 model) and I would expect the app to be of high quality but it is not. I want to love the vacuum but I honestly would have a hard time recommending it to a friend because I am constantly having issues with it not connecting and saying it’s offline. Right now it’s charging on the dock but the app thinks it’s vacuuming my kitchen. The negative reviews you see are legit. Use caution if you buy.

title: Owner 5 / Neato 0
text: I’m on my 2nd Neato vac, the 1st died after 4 solid years of dependable service cleaning the grime left behind 3 sons,  5 grandkids, 4 dogs and 1 crabby farmer. Never have I had such difficulty connecting Anything to our WiFi as I am experiencing with this replacement Neato. The Most Annoying Fact is my attempt to connect (while following the instructions to the letter) FIVE TIMES with ZERO success! I’m surrendering to another product/manufacturer, my time is too valuable (hence the bot-vac) for this nightmare.......

title: Not working after last update
text: I should have listened to my gut and followed the rule:”If it ain’t broke, don’t fix it!” But I was hoping for new features so I updated my perfectly functioning D7 and the Neato app to 2.9.1. Big mistake. Now my robot after about 20 min of cleaning simply stops. No obstructions. No errors. No alerts. It just stops in different random places around the house. Tried resetting it, creating new floor plan maps. So far nothing worked.  I loved that robot. Now I have no choice but to return it.

title: Good features, but
text:
Connecting is a bit convoluted. Would be nice to be able to select multiple zones to clean at same time instead of the work around of scheduling different zones. Otherwise great app. 

Also, would be nice to be able to delete older maps, they keep piling up every time I run the robot.

title: New features
text:
I just updated and the app and happy to see new features.

However in order to use them i have to run a “special” cleaning map.  So far on the first try this apparently failed because my D3 got stuck under my bed ( pretty common occurrence for me) and i had to move it.

Now i have to wait to try the whole thing again?  Why?  I have good maps. Why can’t i use those?  Why can’t the robot just maneuver around scanning, why does it actually need to vacuum to make this map?

Ahhh this software is so close but still a ways off.  

Still glad to have the Neato over the other guys that programmed their robots to move like crack addicts.

title: Used to work fine
text: This app used to work fine. But lately I’m having major issues. I’m stuck at the uploading new map screen, or it can’t load the floor plan, or it doesn’t even show the right statues for my botvac d5. Update the app already! It’s been at least a year. I’m about done with neato products. They’re great when they work, but terrible when they don’t. I’ve had to troubleshoot this thing more than an old cassette tape.

title: Neato D7 App the worst
text: I like my Neato. It does the job and works pretty well. The App on the other hand is the worst. I have had to completely reset and remap my house way too many times. The app makes me hate my Neato Vac. I’ve had it less than two years and plan on replacing it very soon. The only reason, is because of this horrible app. The app says it needs updated…again. This doesn’t mean it actually needs updated. I again have to reset and remap.

title: Some love for the D5?
text:
I noticed that the latest update allows turbo charging and "no go" zones fur the the D7, D6, and even the D4.... But not the D5? What gives? Is this going to be added for the D5 soon? 

 Nice App and our D5 is still going strong a year in... But would really like to see these features added to the D5. Purchased the Neato partly based on strong company support of their older models!

title: Cant adjust the schedule in the app
text: I tried to change the schedule from 4pm every day to 8:15am every day. Apparently it won’t let me choose any days that have already passed this week. It’s likely trying to schedule a cleaning time in the past and erroring out. Scheduling a time and a repeat day that hasn’t passed yet this week works fine. 1) Delete the saved map. 
2) Delete the scheduled cleanings.

4) Add “no go” lines back.

text: I have the D7 and after 4 attempts still do not have an option to save a floor plan. I have floor plans but only an option to “share” them. Who the heck wants to share a robot vacuum’s floor plan! I have to ability to save the floor plan like the support site states.

title: Horrible
text: Just make the vacuum work as it should and all will be good. Have had the robot for a year & have to manually turn it on every day because If I’m not home with my phone the unit will not work. My husband thought he was doing something nice for me by buying the newest model. Piece of crap.

title: A bit clunky but works well
text: Syncing the wifi network and the robot took a few tries. Drawing the no-go line is a bit tricky but overall, im happy with the app.

title: Decent Product undermines by reliability issues and horrible customer service
text: I am on my second until since May 2017.  This unit is currently inoperable.  I would love to know how to troubleshoot, diagnose and repair or replace my unit.  However, 96 hours later and Neato still has not responded to follow up communications after my initial contact.  Horrible customer service.

title: Love hate
text:
The bot cleans great, if you can manage to get it to go through wide open passages to adjoining rooms instead of skipping those rooms, or doing only a portion of a room. 
But this review of the app.  The app blows chunks to rival glaciers.  Intuitive? Not in the least.  Fully functional to address errors and functions of the D7? Not even close.  Trash this garbage app and start fresh.

title: Great app
text: Not sure what all the bad reviews are about. Works well with my D3 and it's a fast + light app. No complaints.

title: Dissatisfaction Guaranteed
text:
Two Neatos’s in two years are two too many. $800 for a vacuum that can’t remember the vacuum pattern it prepared itself is ridiculous. 

That the battery dies, not needing a charge but a replacement battery, is beyond ridiculous. 

It’s supposed to have saved me time but every frustrating minute wasted trying to get it to turn on and vacuum shows that time is money and I wasted both X 2!

Customer service is always very nice and helpful, but the issue is not the company’s customer service it’s their product.

title: D7 app- problems
text: Bad app. After creating map and renaming, try to add no go lines. After adding no goes and trying to use next time, app does not work after starting. Now having problems even trying to create new map after deleting old one. Support not good.

title: Absolute TRASH!
text: If I could give less than one star I would! The vacuum is great but, the app is a steaming pile of garbage and has been for quite some time. One of my two vacuums almost never connects and the other has said “app update required” for close to two months now with no indication of how to update the app or anything. FIGURE IT OUT!!!!!

title: Something has gone wrong
text: The app is now unusable. I have 2 Neato d3 connected bots, and yet the app no longer shows either of them even though they were previously connected fine. When I try to do anything in the app it says “something has gone wrong” with no action items to resolve the issue. 1 star.

title: Stick to Roomba
text:
Not worth your time or your money.
The machine itself is incapable, it took me a year to make my apartment "Neato-proof".
It disconnects constantly, it's entirely incompatible with one of my routers, the app is never updated, their customer service is immensely incompetent.
Don't bother, you have more to lose than anything.

title: Keeps saying app update required
text:
Have the latest update but keeps saying app update required making the app unusable. Stop telling people to contact you about this issue. It’s clearly something wrong on your end.
Also vacuum skips bathrooms most of the time. Why??

title: The App is Pathetic and Lacking!
text: Terrible app with terrible options and configuration. An item as expensive as this should not be lacking this much considering it is built around the fact that you control it with the app. Get a different vacuum is my suggestion.

title: Will not pair
text:
The robot just will not enter pairing mode.  Easily loses WiFi connection then ...  cycles endlessly when using the power off then on method to enter pairing mode.

Unreliable.  Period.

Desperately needs an update to fix this.  Way too expensive to have something like this make the robot useless.

title: Can’t’ Get Past App Wizard
text: I’m an IT expert by occupation. Trying to get this vacuum to connect to the internet via this extremely useless mobile app wizard is beyond frustrating. Will probably return it. At least with the Roomba, I had the option of entering the wifi password to connect the vac.

title: Awesome Vacuum, Manual mode does not work
text: My Neato D7 Connected worked perfectly!! UNTIL the app update. Now manual mode does not work. At all. Extremely disappointed. I have called/chatted with tech support and they ensured me their engineers are working on a fix. Not happy.

title: Updates Successful
text: My older D3 now has no-go lines thanks to the app updates. Thank you Neato for caring for old and new customers!

title: I like it
text: Does what it is suppose to do most times, I have to reset the robot and the wifi before every use almost though.

title: At least it’s half the price of a roomba 😬
text: The robot always forgets the floor plan and then I have to remap out my entire house every few days. The app connects to the robot maybe 50% of the time. The UI feels cheaply made; and the robot itself clogs too much because the mouth of the dust chamber is too narrow.

title: Doesn’t work
text: All of a sudden about a month ago my vacuum disconnected from the app and I couldn’t reconnect it. I followed the directions exactly and it failed every time. Now the app won’t even allow me to log in and just has the 3 loading dots.

title: Lots of technical issues
text: “No go lines” don’t work and actually make the vacuum not work at all. Zones don’t work either.  Called support and while I talked to someone, I got zero help in return. Really frustrated as the vacuum got really good reviews.

title: Great Robot/Terrible Update
text:
Episode 1
Everything worked great until the update. I can only start Neato manually. Neato cannot upload floor plan old or new even after starting robot again manually. It shows the new floor plan but can’t do anything with it. 
Thanks Mike

Episode 2
Still having App and Neato Robot communication problems even after it was packaged and returned to the repair facility per the support teams instructions. I received the Neato back within 2-3 days with NO information on what the repair involved and no instructions on what to do or expect to happen. 
SAD, SAD, SAD...

title: “Cannot download floor plan”
text:
I miss my Roomba!
When the D7 works it is great but it doesn’t work. I don’t know if it’s the app or the unit. It will start up the stop 10in from the base. It will not let me edit floor plans. It will clean part of a room and just stop. If you try to find any reviews on the web you will only find paid reviews.

title: D3
text: We have bought 2 of these, we can’t keep one working and the other won’t stay connected to the phone app but works.

title: Uploading New Map issues
text: The app works fine until it doesn’t. It get stuck “Uploading New Map” any time I try and click start.

title: New update created more problems
text: The latest update didn’t fix or improve much but sure created more bugs and problems. Robot gets lost in empty room, robot gets “stuck” in the middle of an empty room as well. Needs major update

title: Should have listened
text: I should have listened to the complaints on here . I’ve been constantly fighting software issues with this thing . Their latest firmware update has left the robot unable to function . Should have just gone with a roomba.

title: Does Everything I Was Promised plus
text: One day, a new feature popped up.

title: Needs functionality to stop it from beeping
text: The most annoyed I am with Neato is how many times you have to shut it up from complaining. This needs a better way to make it quiet

title: Won’t connect to app
text: This is awful.  The bot doesn’t connect to My IPad or IPhone, just keeps saying the bot is off-line.  Followed all the steps and still not connected.  You would think that after paying all that money for something, it would at least have an app that actually works.

title: Change our lives !
text:
This robot vacuum has changed our life cleaning !  You set and let it go !! 
Just wish it would dump it own bin

title: Extremely Frustrating
text: This app hasn’t received an update in over a year. It doesn’t work with Apple’s newest software. So I cannot use my vacuum. The light on my vacuum just stays red. When I open the app, it says that the app needs an update. It’s all very frustrating.

title: My Neato D4
text:
I love the convenience!!  And it does a good job. 
Don’t like that I don’t have the ability to delete bad or partial floor plans so that it will try to clean my select one.  Ugh
Fix the app, please!!!!!!

title: Robot cleans okay, app connectivity blows
text: Constantly going offline. Very rarely able to use the app to get the Neato to do what I want. I end up picking up the vacuum and moving it from room to room which honestly isn’t much more convenient than just vacuuming myself.

title: Development team needs work
text: Frustrating that with iOS 13 release - the app no longer connects with the robot. Company should have emailed users ahead of time instead of publishing an update to App Store that literally does not work. Robot has been down for a month with no eta provided.

title: Very frustrated with the whole system!!!
text: All was great for a few months, Penelope (my neato) was amazing! She did everything I hoped she would. Now I’m lucky if she can finish the whole floor, mostly she just stops in the middle of the room. The app always seems to say ‘connecting’ I have looked at the troubleshooting...getting nowhere fast! 😡

title: Please bring back Manual drive.
text:
Please bring back Manual drive. I used this daily after meal prep. It went away after the update. One of the things I loved.  

The app is simple but works. I have had no issues with the app until the manual drive went away. I have a Neato Connect and according to Neato the software is up to date.

title: Great features, terrible functionality.
text: The idea of the app things you are supposed to be able to donate fantastic, but be prepared to waste an entire day trying to reconnect your vacuum when it decide to work every few weeks.

title: Inconsistent performance
text: This app does not work very well, the robot cannot connect to the Wi-Fi through the app. Now the robot sits idle; a lot of money spent for no benefit. The vacuum itself was great, but without the app you’re dead in the water. Recommend going with any large robotic name with good support.

title: Neato D3
text: Just bought this unit and unfortunately the unit will not connect to my wifi. I have watched numerous of videos and tech support but nothing is working. Was excited to own this vacuum but now we can’t even get it to move off the charger and connect. Very frustrating.

title: Not worth the costly price tag
text: Biggest complaint is that the so-called “no-go” lines are never working so you have to make sure you close the doors wherever you don’t want the device to go. And if you have to do they, then what’s the point? Will go back to Roomba.

title: wifi conneting bad

title: No way
text: If the robot is working and I get a phone call or a visitor arrives, I want to Pause the robot.  While the App allows me to Pause the robot, Once the robot is Paused, the App does not allow me to Start the robot back up.  There is no way to start it again.  The new version of the App is terrible.  Bring back the old version.

title: Terrible product.
text: What’s so frustrating is having to spend 20 minutes cleaning the vacuum after use or it basically dies in the middle of the room and you have to perform a complete reboot.  I wish I hadn’t bought this terribly flawed product.

title: Terrible connectivity issues
text: Robot randomly disconnects from WiFi and fails to connect over and over and over again. Have to delete the robot and restart basically everything on a monthly basis.

title: Game Changer!
text: It used to take me an hour a week to vacuum my house, now I can do something else while my NEATO does his thing.

title: Can’t get it to work properly.
text: Honestly I would be happy if I can get the schedule to work. I have always been a neato fan and this is my third one, but first one with an app. And feeling really discouraged right now. I really wish I can get this app to work cause basically the only way u can program the vacuum.

title: Steering
text: I used to be able to steer the robot with the app, but now it’s not available. Maybe it was the last robot. When it gets lost on the way back to the dock, it would be great to be able to steer it home again.

title: Very frustrating indeed
text: We specifically wanted the D7 so we could do scheduled cleaning via the app etc. This seldom works, even if we manage to catch the Neato on the network (it tends to drop all the time). Since we paid considerable $$ for this robot, we just want to kick ourselves.

title: We should all file a class action lawsuit
text: This is an insult to capitalism. Pure greed. They need to return all of our money. It is actually illegal to bait and switch as well as sell a product which doesn’t actually work when it states that it does.

title: Frustrated!
text:

The device will not stay connected to the phone.

If this is going to continue to be an issue then some offline functionality that will push updates to the vacuum when it decides to remain connected would be nice.

title: Terrible interface. Does not connect
text: Device frequently goes offline. Resetting to connect to home network is cumbersome and not effective. In operable in online mode. Would never pay for this device again.

title: Awful crap that doesn’t work

App update required but there’s no updates in the store. And it doesn’t allow me to use it.

title: Super cool product!

title: No connection
text: I have a strong WiFi provider and somehow the it cannot identify the WiFi that is 3 feet away. It found the neighbor’s WiFi about 150 yards away. We’ve spent about an hour trying to set-up the app and nothing. We are quite technologically savvy.  The app, not so much. If there were a 0, I’d choose it.

title: Does not connect to WiFi!

title: App update required
text: Haven’t been able to use D5 for months now due to app update message.  I am on iOS 13.3.  When will this be resolved?

Annoying, terrible, ridiculous, incompetent.

title: Great

title: Don’t Buy a D6 or D7!!!
